title: Scatter Site Program Director
description:
**JOB SCOPE:**

The Scatter Site Program Director is a Senior Manager responsible for overseeing a program that operates 145 scatter site housing beds, where clients live independently throughout the Bronx, Manhattan, Queens, and Brooklyn. The Director ensures that the program and its residences comply with applicable regulatory standards set forth by the NYS Office of Mental Health, NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene, NYC Department of Homeless Services, and or the United States Department of Housing and Development. The position supervises a team of 1 Field Coordinator and 8 Case Managers who primarily conduct in-person home visits.

The role is based at **1775 Grand Concourse in the Bronx**. Major areas of responsibility include ensuring quality case management and care for all residents, maintaining comprehensive case records, providing leadership and supervision of direct care staff, oversight of the maintenance operations of the facilities, responding to crises, and administrative reporting.

The Scatter Site Program Director is responsible for the clinical, operational, and financial functions of the residence.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

- Oversees all social/clinical services and program operations.  
- Directly supervises program staff and shared clinical/program services staff. The program operates during business hours only, but the Scatter Site Program Director remains on call for after-hours and weekend emergencies.  
- Conducts weekly (or as needed) individual supervision meetings with each Residential Counselor or Case Manager, and Front Desk Counselors.  Responsible for hiring all program staff.  
- Ensures that residents follow appropriate psychiatric and medical plans; approves individual service plans for each resident. Integrates services of the Health Care Coordinator with other program and case management services.  
- Maintains case records in accordance with regulatory requirements; reviews individual case records and signs off as indicated; approves admission and discharge summaries.  
- Ensures that counselors’ paperwork is completed in a timely and thorough manner.  
- Conducts and participates in case conferences  
- Designs and implements a quality assurance and utilization review plan for the Residence; monitors compliance and reports regularly to the Regional Director on the status of compliance efforts.  
- Reports all untoward incidents and directs follow-up of incidents.  Investigate and address resident complaints and grievances.  
- Prepare written correspondence and notifications on resident related issues.  Keep PCMH Administrators and Managers aware of significant events and issues within the facility.  
- Conducts internal audits of clinical case records, financial records, and all other program documentation to ensure compliance with city, state, and federal regulations. Responsible for maintaining all facility licenses, accreditation and certifications.  
- Monitors compliance with all applicable safety and health code requirements.  
- Maintains productive working relationships with provider groups and referral sources.  
- Adheres, and facilitates adherence of all staff, to personnel and residential policies and procedures as outlined in the PCMH Personnel Policies and Procedures Manual and the Residential Policies & Procedures Manual.  
- Conducts in-service training on a regular basis and ensures that all case managers and counselors are properly trained in counseling techniques, emergency procedures and crisis intervention.  
- Ensures that all staff receives first aid training, and that case managers/counselors have all required credentials on file.  
- Works in collaboration with Property Manager to ensure residents are meeting their leasing and rent obligations to maintain housing.  
- Works in collaboration with Facility Management to ensure the safety and upkeep of the building.  
- Responsible for monitoring spending and documentation of petty cash.  
- Where applicable, helps to ensure compliance with LIHTC regulatory requirements, including working with residents to obtain required documentation.  
- Performs other duties, consistent with the goals and objectives of the program, as assigned by the Regional Director, or Director of Residential Services.

**KNOWLEDGE:**   
- Paycom

- Microsoft Office  
- Foothold AWARDS

- NYS OMH Licensed Housing Regulations, NYS OMH Supported Housing Guidelines, and/or NYC DOHMH Supported Housing Standards.

**SKILLS AND ABILITIES:**   
- Excellent oral and written communication skills  
- Strong organizational and system tracking skills  
- Excellent judgment  
- Detail oriented  
- Ability to work proactively  
- Ability to problem solve  
- Ability to think critically  
- Ability to think strategically  
- Ability to effectively manage time  
- Ability to manage and minimize agency risk.  
- Ability to engage resident population  
- Ability to appropriately assess and respond to crises  
- Ability to demonstrate flexibility, creativity, and initiative  
- Ability to handle multiple tasks and shift between responsibilities  
- Ability to teach, train, and supervise others in mental health case management services - Ability to work effectively with others and demonstrate conflict resolution skills

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**   
- Minimum of a Master’s Degree in a Mental Health discipline or related field is required in Licensed Housing.  
- Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in a Mental Health discipline or related field with 5 years related experience for Supported Housing required.  
- Computer literate with knowledge of Microsoft Office, spreadsheets, and publishing

software.  
- Minimum five (5) years residential management experience in the mental health field.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**

This position operates in an agency Residential Facility. The position requires regular entry into personal residential units.  
The position uses standardized office equipment such as phones, computers, fax machines, and copiers.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

The Americans with Disability Act prohibits discrimination against a qualified individual with a disability. To be qualified for this position an individual must meet the following standards and/or be able to perform the essential functions and activities.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee

**to successfully perform the essential functions for this job.**   
While performing the duties of this job, the physical activities for this position involve:

1. Ability to sit and/or stand for long periods of time.  
2. Ability to present information verbally in front of large groups.  
3. Ability to travel to and within fieldwork sites and other locations.  
4. Speaking and hearing ability sufficient to communicate effectively by phone or in person at normal volumes.  
5. Vision adequate to read correspondence, computer screen, forms, etc.,  
6. Good manual dexterity.

**WORK RELATIONS AND TEAMWORK:**

Understands the relationship of this job to the company’s mission and to other jobs in the company. Works with co-workers, supervisors, and staff from other departments to solve problems and improve processes and services.

**RESIDENT, CLIENT, GUEST AND STAFF FOCUS:**

Is sensitive to practical, emotional, and spiritual needs of all residents, clients, and staff members

in all interactions. Provides timely feedback, meaningful comments, and clear direction around

case management related activities. Adjust priorities and schedules to address high profile issues, deadlines, and emergency situations. Keeps relevant staff informed of residential incidents and

fosters teamwork to bring about the best possible outcome for all. OTHER DUTIES:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of

activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* How many staff members are you overseeing in your most recent role?
* what is your expected salary range?

title: Group Leader
description:
SUMMARY

The Southern Queens Parks Association is looking for a dynamic individual to join the team as a **Group Leader** at the P.S. 35Q Nathaniel Woodhull School COMPASS program. The Comprehensive Afterschool System (COMPASS) of NYC program serves young people enrolled in grades K-12. SONYC, which stands for School’s Out NYC, is the COMPASS’ middle school model that serves as a pathway to success for youth in 6th, 7th and 8th grades. Structured like clubs, the model offers youth choice in how they spend their time; provides rigorous instruction in sports, arts and youth leadership. NYC becomes the classroom through trips and opportunities for instruction beyond the traditional facilities. Programs are offered 5 days per week during the school year. Services are also offered during the summer months. This specific outreach operates under the SQPA umbrella through use of its facilities, programming and thought leaders.

ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

The Group Leader will be responsible for providing direct support with homework assignments and academic services to meet the identified needs of students. Under the supervision of certified staff, you will work with small groups of students in content area instruction, notably English Language Arts, Math, Science, and Social Studies. Group Leaders also assist with physical education, visual and performing arts activities. While supporting students in identifying resources to complete assignments, the Group Leader is responsible for planning lessons, posting student learning objectives, implementing the assigned goals, and providing an interactive learning environment.

Primary Job Duties:

* Provide general supervision of students during program operating times and ensures a safe environment.
* Keep all activities, equipment, and facilities clean, sanitized, safe, and in working order in compliance with program guidelines and procedures.
* Promote independent growth by encouraging critical thinking, facilitating research projects, working in partnerships, and collaborative groups.
* Communicate and encourage positive feedback on the students’ progress towards academic excellence and accountability.
* Escorts students from one activity to another in an orderly manner.
* Plan and demonstrate strong knowledge of the curriculum and varied instructional methodologies when working collaboratively with the Educational Specialist or other identified staff to plan engaging lessons.
* Understands, articulates, and utilizes the DYCD core competencies in conjunction with instruction and planning.
* Participate in staff satisfaction surveys, evaluations, and reviews.
* Attends mandatory staff program training, meetings, and case conferences.
* Provide supervision, direction and feedback to program youth, support staff, interns, and volunteers.
* Maintains regular open communication with parents, staff, and direct supervisors; report any incidents and concerns to the Assistant Site Program Director and Site Program Director.
* Keep daily records of all inspections, uses, participants, and incidents for equipment and facilities.
* Perform other projects assigned at the discretion of the Assistant Site program Director and Site Program Director.

COMPENSATION

* Part-time in-person role that will be paid $17 per hour.

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION

SQPA welcomes applications from all, and strongly encourages women, people of color, people with disabilities, immigrants, refugees & LGBTQ people to apply for this position. We are committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization and recruiting a team that reflects the diversity of our community.

Schedule:

* Approximately 30 hours per week
* Training Required

WHO WE ARE

Established in 1976, Southern Queens Park Association’s mission is to coordinate and provide comprehensive programs for children, youth, adults, families, and seniors residing in Southern Queens. SQPA finds innovative ways to combine its stewardship of the 54-acre Southern Queens-Roy Wilkins Park with its mission to enhance the quality of life of residents in Southern Queens.

SQPA has strategically located service sites throughout Southern Queens and was constituted to actively combat the social issues that challenge or impact the quality of life in the geographic area in and around Jamaica, Queens. SQPA is not a part of the New York City Department of Parks & Recreation but is an anchor institution that serves as an intermediary, facilitator, organizer, advocate, provider, and sanctuary.

HOW TO APPLY

It is best to apply at the original listing located at https://sqpa.bamboohr.com/careers

Please complete the application there and include all requested documents. Thank you.

title: Behavioral Health Technician
description:
**COME JOIN OUR TEAM!**

Luxe Behavioral Health is an expanding company providing Sober Living services to clients engaged in Substance Abuse Partial Care and Intensive Outpatient, Co-Occurring treatment. We are seeking compassionate individuals with strong interpersonal skills who have a strong desire to help those suffering from substance abuse/mental health issues who want to remain living in the community while they attend treatment. The ideal candidates would preferably, although not necessarily, have an educational and/or working knowledge of substance abuse and mental health issues.

**Position Overview:**

Luxe Sober Living’s Behavioral Health Technicians (BHTs) are responsible for the complete care and well-being of clients while they are residing with our program, including observing and reporting the day-to-day behaviors and whereabouts for clients involved in differing levels of the housing program, reporting any concerning behaviors to the appropriate parties, providing encouragement and support for clients while they navigate early recovery, promoting 12-step recovery involvement, and ensuring the overall safety and well-being for all clients and staff residing and working in the residence.

The core functions are to be responsible for supervising and supporting patients in our residential treatment setting throughout the day, evening, and night, and maintaining structure for clients. BHTs facilitate recreational activities, transport patients to and from outside medical appointments in a company vehicle, assist clients in developing a sober network through self-help attendance and sponsorship, provide support and encouragement in early recovery, and ensure clients are complying with program rules through compassionate yet professional boundary setting and supervision in accordance with program guidelines.

**Basic Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Working daily with residents to provide support, encouragement, and guidance
* Recognizing crisis situations, providing appropriate interventions based on training and experience and assisting in emergency situations as directed
* Organize and supervise activities for residents when on duty and ensuring residents attend as scheduled (both for daily programming and weekend "fun" activities - bowling, movies, Great Adventure, Top Golf, etc.)
* Utilize, document, and record keep in our Electronic Medical Record system (EMR)
* Closely monitor residents for signs of relapse and/or substance-abuse behaviors; report to supervisors as necessary
* Have a professional demeanor and ability to act professionally with clients and staff at all times

**Qualifications Include:**

* High school diploma or high school equivalency diploma and one year experience working in a healthcare related field; **-or-**
* An associate’s or bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a field which is unrelated to healthcare with six months experience working in adult addiction and/or mental health group homes; **-or-**
* An associate’s or bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in psychology, addictions, social work, or a related field; **-or-**
* An active CADC or enrolled as a CADC Intern obtaining supervision
* Experience in an addiction/mental health or related field and/or a working knowledge of addictions is preferred, but not required
* Active driver’s license and insurable on company insurance to drive company vehicles
* If in recovery, must have at least one (1) year sober, two (2) years preferred
* Willing to maintain CPR and Narcan training/certifications - job provides this training
* The position requires walking and standing both indoors and outdoors

**If you are seeking to be part of a spirit-filled team and to make an impact changing lives, your search has ended. Apply now!**

**Job Type**

* Full-time, Part-Time, Per Diem available

**Benefits (Full-Time Employees only):**

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

**Shifts**

Luxe Behavioral Health offers flexible hours to meet both the needs of the company and the needs of the employee. Full-time, part-time, and per-diem shifts available as are 8-hour, 10-hour and/or 12-hour shifts to meet the coverage needs.

**Evenings/Overnights/Weekends are top priority for filling this position.**

Normal Shift Schedules (includes weekends):

* Overnight - 11:30pm - 7:30am

title: Building Superintendent
description:
\\*Job Overview\\*

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Building Superintendent/Engineer to oversee the maintenance and operations of our facilities. The ideal candidate will have an especially strong mechanical/enginerring background, as well as exceptional communication and leadership skills to ensure the smooth functioning of the building. Superintendent will be responsible for managing all back-of-house repsonsibilities, and coordinating with housekeeping staff, other maintenance staff, as well as front-of-house personnel.

\\*Duties\\*

- Supervise and coordinate maintenance staff

- Maintain building systems including HVAC, logic controllers, and electrical systems

- Interpret schematics and use a voltmeter for troubleshooting

- Utilize Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS) for tracking work orders

- Ensure compliance with safety regulations and protocols

- Conduct regular inspections to identify maintenance needs

\\*Experience\\*

- Proficient in English for effective communication

- Demonstrated leadership abilities in a maintenance setting

- Mechanical knowledge for troubleshooting and repairs

title: Live-In Facilities Manager
description:
**CIS Management, Inc. an Award Winning Property Management Company provides comprehensive and responsive property management services. Recognized as one of New Jersey’s premier affordable and creative housing solutions provider, CIS Management is committed to a hands-on, around-the-clock approach. We are recruiting to fill our Full-time Live-In Facilities Manager position in Bloomfield, NJ (55+ Senior Living).** 

The Facilities Manager is responsible for obtaining bids for work orders, overseeing maintenance staff (if applicable) and completing work orders. The Facilities Manager must have excellent organizational skills, the ability to prioritize workload, professional and helpful demeanor on the phone and in person, strong attention to detail, and a common knowledge of general maintenance work. ***The Facilities Manager lives on site.***

**RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO:**

* Ensure community facilities are well maintained
* Schedule and participate in maintenance projects
* Responds to “after hours” emergencies
* Perform routine inspections of all maintained property and report findings to the Property Manager
* Perform plumbing work such as clearing stoppages, replacing fittings, zone valves, pipe sections, etc
* Perform carpentry work such as fitting doors, replacing molding, repairing structural framing, and refinishing floors
* Clean grounds, laundry rooms and common areas
* Paint, tape and spackle
* Repair concrete, masonry, roofing and fences
* Maintain HVAC systems
* Maintain accurate records regarding preventive maintenance, work orders, turnovers, annual inspections, inventories and purchase orders
* Perform other duties in aligned to the business needs.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Minimum of 3 years’ previous residential maintenance or related experience
* Demonstrated knowledge of basic maintenance and repair skills, including the use of hand tools and other necessary equipment
* Ability to work independently and a willingness to learn.
* Superb customer service orientation and effective oral skills, along with a positive and professional attitude.
* Ability to read, write and speak English sufficiently to process and discuss work orders correctly.
* Ability to use a mop, broom, vacuum cleaner, step ladder, snow blower and leaf blower.
* Must be able to stand for long periods of time (8 hours or more per day) to perform the following physical activities: bending, climbing step ladders, lifting, carrying, grasping, gripping, turning, reaching above shoulders, pushing and pulling, climbing stairs; stooping and squat kneel.

**Schedule:**

***Must be able to work between the appropriate business hours.***

* **MUST be available for On-Call emergencies -Required for living onsite**

Monday - Friday 9:00AM - 5:00PM or 8:30AM - 4:30AM - On-call as needed

* Supplemental life insurance & other plans available
* Paid time off, based on years of service

* Tuition reimbursement up to $5,250.00/annually

title: Retail Merchandiser Floater
description:
Join **Hallmark** as a **Part-Time Retail Merchandiser** **Floater** in **Bellmore, NY**! This is your opportunity to represent the world's best-known greeting card brand and play a crucial role in merchandising, creating, and building displays within your territory for a positive shopper experience. We offer you work life integration within the work week, while supporting the business needs. You will be required to service stores based on the scheduling tool you are provided. We offer paid: training, travel time, and mileage reimbursement. Are you ready to **make your mark**?


**JOB OVERVIEW**  

As a Retail Merchandiser Floater, you'll have the opportunity to work independently to showcase your organization and time management skills, your ability to establish retailer relationships, while being the face of Hallmark. You will collaborate with local store teams to optimize product placement and maintain inventory levels as well as support fellow team members with seasonal resets and installations, when needed. On occasion Hallmark may ask you to service another vendor's product in a store that you are assigned to. If that is the case, you will be provided detailed instructions and additional budgeted time.

  




**To learn more about this role, please click** **to watch our retail merchandisers floater in action.**  

  

**SALARY AND SHIFT DETAILS**

* Your starting pay will be upto $16.75 depending on your shift and location.
* This is a Part-Time position with a variable schedule during the work week.
* Weekly hours for this position will vary as per business requirments.
* Availability the week before and after major holidays, which may include weekends is **required**.

  


**YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE**

You'll perform service work in the Hallmark department of various retail stores such as grocery stores, drug stores, department stores, and mass retailers. The retail merchandiser floater position consists of three major components:


* **Day-to-day engagement:** You are responsible for the entire Hallmark product display at your assigned stores. Utilizing a mobile device provided by Hallmark, you'll restock, organize, and monitor the inventory of Hallmark products within and outside the Hallmark department. While using your mobile device you will also be in communication with your supervisor, reporting time, providing feedback, and answering surveys for required merchandising activities. Professional and courteous interaction with store employees, management, and customers is also vital for success in this role.


* **Holiday support:** Hallmark's operations revolve around seasonal demand. Leading up to and following holidays such as Valentine's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas, you can expect additional days and extended hours during the work week. On occasions like Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, and Father's Day, you may be required to work on the actual holiday itself, which may include the weekend.


* **Department Resets:** At times, you may be part of a team responsible for **installations and various tasks** like building and installing Hallmark fixtures, relocating card departments and products, as well as resetting card sections. Typically, you will be notified two weeks in advance for remodel assignments. This could include evenings or weekend.


* **One Team Vision:** As a field organization although you are assigned to your specific responsibilities there may be additional work and installation efforts that you will be asked and required to support.



**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


This is a physically demanding job that requires a high level of energy and a sense of urgency. You will be working on the selling floor as well as in back stockrooms. You must be able to consistently push, pull, lift, and carry cartons, merchandise, and display fixtures up to 30 pounds throughout the workday and up to 50 pounds on occasion. You will also be required to stoop, squat, walk, and stand throughout your workday, and you may be required to climb stairs and step ladders.

  




**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* You're at least 18 years of age.
* You're able to read, write and understand English.
* You have the ability to grasp, pull, lift, and carry products up to 30 pounds frequently and 50 pounds occasionally.
* Able to operate hand-held technology provided to open and read documents and interpret information.
* You have access to a Wi-Fi network and the internet.
* You have reliable transportation to report to assigned locations.


**Prior to applying, please click** **to watch retail merchandisers** **floater at work.**

  

**Now's your chance to Make Your Mark—just follow the instructions below to apply.**


You must show how you meet the basic qualifications in a resume or document you upload, or by completing the work experience and education application fields. Accepted file types are DOCX and PDF.  

  

Part-time employees with a work schedule less than 30 hours have access to a variety of voluntary benefits through ; including dental, vision, critical illness, accident insurance, hospital indemnity and minimum essential coverage (preventive care).


#LI-DD1
company_description: Hallmark Cards, Inc. helps people live more caring and connected lives full of meaningful moments. Join our team to make the world a more caring place.

title: Student Systems Coordinator
description:
**Reports to:** Director of Student Services & Director of Talent & Operations

**Position Type:** Full-Time, On-site, hours: 7:15 AM - 4:00 PM

**Overview:** Manhattan Charter School is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Student Systems Coordinator to manage and maintain our student information systems. This position is crucial in ensuring accurate and efficient handling of student data, supporting school operations, and enhancing the educational experience of our students. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data management, exceptional technical skills, and a passion for supporting educational environments.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Student Information System (SIS) Management:**
* Administer and maintain the school’s SIS, ensuring data accuracy and system reliability.
* Train staff on the effective use of the SIS and provide ongoing technical support.
* Develop and implement procedures for data entry, data integrity, and data security.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for SIS-related issues and troubleshooting.
* Coordinate with IT staff to resolve technical problems and implement system updates.
* Maintain documentation of system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guidelines.
* **Data Management:**
* Collect, organize, and analyze student data, including enrollment, attendance, grades, and demographics.
* Generate and distribute regular and ad-hoc reports to school administrators and staff.
* Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local data reporting requirements.
* Work closely with school administrators, teachers, and support staff to address data needs and improve system functionalities.
* Participate in regular meetings to discuss data trends, system updates, and process improvements.
* Provide training sessions and workshops for staff on data management and system usage.
* **Compliance and Reporting:**
* Ensure all student data is managed in compliance with FERPA and other relevant privacy regulations.
* Prepare and submit required reports to state and federal education agencies.
* Monitor and audit data entries for accuracy and completeness.
* **Information Technology (IT):**
* Support the implementation and maintenance of the school’s IT infrastructure.
* Coordinate with IT staff or external vendors to resolve technical issues promptly.
* Ensure all technology systems are secure, up-to-date, and operating efficiently.
* Provide basic technical support and training for staff and students as needed.
* **Facilities Management:**
* Support the maintenance and repair of school facilities, ensuring a safe and clean environment.
* Coordinate with custodial staff and external contractors for regular maintenance and emergency repairs.
* Support the scheduling and use of school facilities for both internal and external events.
* Ensure compliance with health, safety, and building regulations.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Education, or a related field.
* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data management or a similar role, preferably in an educational setting.
* Proficiency in using student information systems (experience with [specific SIS, e.g., PowerSchool, Infinite Campus] preferred).
* Experience with admissions processes and strategies.
* Strong technical skills, including knowledge of database management, data analysis tools, and MS Office Suite.
* Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and adapt to changing priorities.
* Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in data handling.
* Commitment to the mission and values of Manhattan Charter School

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Supportive and collaborative work environment.

title: Junior Estimator
description:
Come join the best heating service company in the NYC area!

Controlled Combustion is a diverse and stable 40-year-old full service commercial heating company comprised of over 150 employees is looking to add a **Junior Estimator** to its team. The company is seeking candidates that are looking for a workplace in which to grow and prosper.

The Junior Estimator will be responsible for creating and managing estimates for projects. The ability to multitask, prioritize, and communicate effectively will be crucial in this role.

**Responsibilities**

* Analyzing requirement documents, blueprints and project plans to gain a thorough understanding of the project
* Determining what factors of production will influence the cost of a service or product
* Preparing material estimates and cost estimates for the product or service
* Creating labor estimates for any project
* Developing and maintaining relationships with company vendors and contractors
* Managing bids from vendors and contractors
* Using bid data to prepare detailed a cost analysis
* Compiling and recording actual costs
* Accurately estimate plan/spec and design/build boiler systems using computer estimating systems and other related software
* Maintain estimating logs and unit costs for all projects
* Establish and maintain vendor relationships
* Perform site surveys and attend pre-bid walkthroughs
* Interact with the sales and project management teams to ensure all projects are performed under budget and according to plans and specifications

**Qualifications**

* Three (3) years of estimating experience in the HVAC industry with a proven track record is required
* Ability to read and comprehend blueprints and other construction documents
* Ability to assess piping requirements (size, distance, etc.)
* Knowledge of different types of boilers systems and their components
* Thorough understanding of related trades for the purposes of coordinating various project estimates
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products
* Proficiency in mathematics, statistics and data analysis
* Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
* Report writing and strategic planning skills
* Familiarity with analyzing requirement data to develop material and cost estimates for large projects
* Expertise with analytic tools, such as spreadsheets and database managers
* Excellent written communication and interpersonal skills
* Exceptional time management skills

Pay: $29.00 - $34.00 per hour

title: Hourly Shift Leader
description:
We’re looking for entry-level leaders who are passionate and ready to collaborate, lead, and give their best every day! In this role, your responsibilities will consist of both coordinating and troubleshooting daily activities of our customer service employees, as well as taking part in store management duties and projects. Through these responsibilities you will gain a deep understanding of our values, business measures and operations, experiencing everything from daytime to nighttime hours, often acting as a liaison between different areas of the store. You will be responsible for leading and developing a team of customer service focused team members, ensuring they have the tools and resources to be successful at their jobs. If you love to work in a fast-paced, energetic environment where no two days are the same, then this is the role for you!

What will I do?

* Independently manage store operations between daytime and nighttime hours, acting as key leader and liaison among teams and various departments throughout the store; responsible for closing and/or opening the store, as part of a varied schedule that changes on a weekly basis
* Partner with department management to prioritize and delegate tasks and ensure the Front End/customer checkout operations runs efficiently, monitoring the business and customer traffic throughout the store, managing the right number of open checkout lanes and running register when necessary to reduce customer wait time
* Manage performance of a team of Customer Service employees, providing resources, training, feedback, and development opportunities
* Provide Incredible Customer Service to customers and employees alike, acting as a champion throughout the store for our values and standards
* Quickly react to situations that arise, partnering with store leadership to problem solve operational challenges
* Participate in and/or lead special projects and assignments across the store with the goal of bringing employees together and enhancing the Company culture

Required Qualifications

* 1 or more years of work experience, preferably in customer service, or a college degree
* Computer skills
* Proven ability to multi-task and handle interruptions in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications

* Experience leading a team
* Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new situations and subject matters

At Wegmans, we’ve long believed we can achieve our goals only if we first fulfill the needs of our people. Putting our people first and offering competitive pay and a variety of benefits & perks is just the start of what it means to work at Wegmans.

Whether through premium pay for working on Sundays or holidays, offering industry-leading health care coverage and wellness programs to support physical, financial, and emotional well-being, or paid time off (PTO) to help you balance work and life, we’ve got something for everyone.

And because we care about the wellbeing and success of every person, we recognize each person has their own unique scheduling needs. We’re proud to offer flexibility in scheduling so our employees can prioritize what is most important to them. Our large, high-volume stores and 24x7 operations allow for personalized schedules that balance an employee’s individual needs with the needs of our business and each department.

**Comprehensive benefits\\***

* Paid time off (PTO) to help you balance your personal and work life
* Higher premium pay rates for working Sundays or on a recognized holiday
* Health care benefits that provide a high level of coverage at a low cost to you
* Retirement plan with both a profit-sharing and 401(k) match
* A generous scholarship program to help employees meet their educational goals
* LiveWell Employee & Family program to support your emotional, work-life and financial wellness
* Exclusive discounts on electronics, entertainment, gym memberships, travel and more!
* And more!

*\\*\\*\\*Certain eligibility requirements must be satisfied and offerings may differ based upon area or the company and/or position.*

For 25 years in a row, our employees have put us on the FORTUNE magazine’s list of the 100 Best Companies to Work For®. Discover what it means to work for a family-owned, mission-driven, values-based company that believes in caring, respect, empowerment, high standards and making a difference in the community. Because with a family-like atmosphere of shared support, leaders who have your best interest at heart and growth as part of everything we do, Wegmans is the place for you to do what you love—and love what you do.

title: Private Nanny
description:
**Absolute Best Care Nanny Agency is the largest and most successful agency on Long Island. The #1 local agency for nannies on Indeed for Long Island. Never a fee to nannies. Work with local people who are familiar with Long Island. We have been placing childcare providers for 17 years on Long Island. Our success rate with all positions is over 90%. All of our full time positions are on a set schedule, come with 2 weeks paid vacation, personal and sick days, major federal holidays off with pay and gas reimbursement for use of your car. We treat our nannies well-we need you to be successful.**

A very nice professional couple with two children is looking for the right nanny to be a part of the family long-term. They have two children that are 4 & 6. The schedule is Monday-Friday from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm, for a take home of $25 per hour. Weekly salary of $1,312. Morning routine, drop off and then light HK duties until pick up time from school. Then the after-school routine. You will NOT be expected to do full HK.

Responsibilities: The kids are in school full time between 9-2/3 pm and we are looking for someone who can drive the kids to and from school (5 minutes from our home) and who can care for our kids before and after school until we get home from work. This will include driving the kids to after-school activities and helping with homework. We also need help with the kids laundry, straightening up the kids toys/rooms, and light housework.

2 weeks paid vacation, paid Holidays, sick days, personal days. A great opportunity for a long-term position.

Qualities: We are looking for a nanny who respects and loves our kids and who makes their safety and well-being the priority. We are looking for someone who is mature, attentive, kind, professional and patient. We want the person we hire to take initiative in our home.

This is a serious long-term position for qualified candidates. The family is looking for the right person for a long-term position and be part of the family. If you don't have experience as a nanny, you will not be considered.

Requirements:2 years as a nanny(not sitter) for one family. Clean license and your own car, must be legal to work. All references will be verified.

* PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF ANY OF THE FOLLOWING APPLY. NO EXCEPTIONS.
* If you live out of state, or if you live in Manhattan, Bronx or Brooklyn.
* All candidates must be local-30/35 minutes from job at maximum.
* If you do not drive you can't be considered for this position.
* This is a long-term position. You must be able to commit for years.
* No full-time nanny experience within the past 3 years.
* No nanny experience at all-Please don't apply. This job is not right for you.

title: Chronic Care Case Manager
description:
Carecloud is actively seeking Certified/Registered Medical Assistants, medical coders, and other similarly qualified professionals to serve our Medicare demographic. The role of a Chronic Care Case Manager is pivotal, demanding efficiency and compassion in delivering patient-centered care. Exceptional customer service skills are essential for establishing rapport through meaningful and relevant interactions over the phone. Fluency in both English and Spanish are required.

The successful Chronic Care Case Manager will leverage their healthcare experience, talents, and problem-solving abilities to oversee a monthly patient roster, ensuring comprehensive care for each individual. Utilizing CareCloud’s proprietary applications, the manager will maintain consistent and compliant services while crafting and updating personalized care plans. Aiming for a patient engagement rate of 90% or higher, the manager is expected to persistently reach out to patients, keeping the healthcare team informed with the latest updates. This role involves both autonomous work and collaboration with a team of dedicated healthcare professionals committed to outstanding patient care.

The position is tailored for candidates adept at providing telephonic patient care, acting as an integral part of the clinical team. Responsibilities include conducting monthly assessments, reviewing medications, coordinating with family members and caregivers, and liaising with office support staff.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Provide case management services to patients with chronic or complex conditions
* Assess patient’s current health status, treatment plan, services, short/long-term goals, provider options
* Develop a care plan using judgment and assessment skills
* Provide patient education and ongoing monitoring of care plan to evaluate effectiveness, modifying as needed.
* Coordinate services required to enhance wellness and manage chronic conditions, improve quality of life, and decrease emergency room visits and avoidable hospital admissions
* Advocate for patients, act as liaison, escalate information as appropriate
* Complete documentation/reporting in accordance with company procedure
* Administrative, reporting, documentation tasks as assigned
* Manage/Oversee Chronic Care Case Management team, including timesheet and PTO approvals
* Participate in hiring process of additional Chronic Care Case Management team members
* Perform supplementary assignments as needed.

**Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**

* 1+ years of experience in the healthcare industry; preferably in internal or family medicine clinic.
* Experience working with chronically ill patients preferred.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and follow HIPAA guidelines.
* Ability to handle difficult and sensitive conversations.
* Type and talk at the same time.
* Comfortable learning and using new EHR platform.
* Proficient in MS Windows, Word, Excel and Outlook.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Must be a team player.
* Present professional and friendly demeanor to client and colleagues.
* Accomplishing tasks with minimal supervision.

**Bilingual Proficiency:**

* Fluent in both English and Spanish
* Ability to communicate effectively in both languages, including speaking, reading and writing to meet patient needs.

**Education and Experience:** 

* 1+ year face-to-face patient healthcare experience
* RN, CCRN, CRNA, MA, CCMA, CMA, RMA, or other relevant medical certification
* Bilingual English/Spanish preferred
* Previous experience with multiple EHR software and platforms

**Education and Experience:** 

* 1+ years of experience in the healthcare industry; preferably in a provider’s office, facility or
* medical billing/RCM company
* Certified/Registered Medical Assistant, Medical Coder or other qualified background

**Supervisory Responsibilities:**

* None

**Physical Requirements:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job includes close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products, equipment and supplies, up to 20 pounds

**Employer’s Rights:**

This job description does not list all the duties of the job. You may be asked by your managers to perform other duties. You will be evaluated in part based upon your performance of the tasks listed in this job description. CareCloud, Inc. and/or its subsidiaries have the right to revise this job description at any time. The job description is not a contract for employment and you or CareCloud, Inc. and/or its subsidiaries may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause and with or without notice.

Assistant Teachers at The Learning Experience are not just educators but ambassadors of happiness. They are responsible for creating moments that echo our mission - to make a difference in the lives of children, their families, and the communities we serve.  

  

**Compensation: $18.25-$22.50/hour**
  

  

**Core Attributes:**  

  

* **Passion for Impact:** A heart that beats for children's developmental needs and happiness.
* **Growth Mindset:** An unyielding belief in the potential of every child and an innate desire to inspire a lifelong love of learning.

**Role Responsibilities:**  

  

* **Classroom Leadership:** Partner closely with teachers to orchestrate a stimulating, welcoming space where children can play, learn, and grow.


* **Curriculum Implementation:** Support teachers in implementing our proprietary L.E.A.P. Curriculum®, adapting your approach to the individual needs of Infants, Toddlers, and/or Preschool children.


* **Safety First:** Always prioritize a safe, nurturing environment where children are safeguarded and can thrive.


* **Family Communication:** Support teachers in regularly updating parents on their child's progress and milestones, leveraging a mix of mobile apps and in-person discussions.


* **Center Collaboration:** Be a team player. Collaborate with center staff and leadership to drive retention, enrollment, and engagement goals.


* **Relationship Builder:** Cultivate warm relationships with families and colleagues, fostering an environment where learning and play coexist effortlessly.


**Qualifications:**  

  

* **Educational Background:** High School Diploma/ GED required. ECE coursework preferred.
	+ At least 18 years of age.
* **Experience:** Prior experience in childcare or a demonstrable passion for early childhood education is preferred.
* **State Compliance:** Must meet state specific guidelines for the role.
	+ Meet state and federal guidelines including performance level, immunizations, employment physicals and required health and safety training.
* **Caregiving Skills:**
	+ Proven judgment to identify and address potential risks in a childcare setting.
	+ Ensure that children are safe and that their everyday needs are met – this may include diapering, dressing, grooming, and feeding.
	+ Model and encourage good social skills, e.g. strong communication and conflict-resolution skills.
	+ Ensure children are kept active, entertained, and engaged in developmentally appropriate activities.
	+ Exhibit high levels of composure, patience, and professionalism at all times.
* **Physical Resilience:**
* Demonstrates full range of motion to:
	+ Stand and walk for extended periods of time without significant discomfort.
	+ Ability to safely lift and carry objects weighing up to 40 pounds.
	+ Reach, stretch with hands and arms.
	+ Climb or balance.
	+ Stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
	+ Use of a stool or ladder to reach high places as necessary.
* Ability to supervise by sight and sound.
* Most days, employee will be working a portion of the day outside in temperatures ranging from 20F with wind chill to 95F.
* Maintain mental and physical alertness and an appropriate level of energy to perform essential job functions.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

title: Store Manager
description:
Denim. It’s our passion. It’s in our blood. But we are not just another denim brand. We’re RAW. Since 1989, we have been pushing the boundaries of denim design, manifesting our own future of denim.

Hardcore Denim is the philosophy that pushes us to invent, explore and take craftsmanship to another level. Down to the smallest detail and with a strong belief that there is no limit to what denim can do. With innovation, sustainability and creativity at our core, we aim to bring pioneering styles and challenge industry standards, while constantly trying to improve our impact on people and planet.

Position Summary:

The Store Manager will be responsible for the hiring, developing and retention of store staff, sales generation, KPI performance, operational excellence, visual presentation and ensuring exceptional customer service.  
.

* Develop business strategies to raise brand awareness, increase store traffic and market share.

title: Assistant Manager
description:
Denim. It’s our passion. It’s in our blood. But we are not just another denim brand. We’re RAW. Since 1989, we have been pushing the boundaries of denim design, manifesting our own future of denim.

Hardcore Denim is the philosophy that pushes us to invent, explore and take craftsmanship to another level. Down to the smallest detail and with a strong belief that there is no limit to what denim can do. With innovation, sustainability and creativity at our core, we aim to bring pioneering styles and challenge industry standards, while constantly trying to improve our impact on people and planet.

Job Title: Assistant Store Manager

Position Summary:

The Assistant Store Manager will be responsible for the assisting the Store Manager with hiring, developing and retention of store staff, sales generation, KPI performance, operational excellence, visual presentation and ensuring exceptional customer service.

Responsibilities:

· Drive Sales through strong KPI performance.

· Ensuring that sales goals and expectations are achieved through customer service and regular monitoring.

· Overseeing the performance management of the store staff to achieve the desired results.

· Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent customer service.

· Assist with store administration (scheduling, back of house, etc.) and ensure compliance with policies and procedures.

· Responsible for ensuring that all customer service initiatives are in place, dealing with issues quickly and courteously.

· They will train, challenge, motivate, encourage, and provide constructive guidance to the store staff related to all areas of effective operations.

· Visual merchandising skills.

· Assist with ensuring operational excellence, as it relates to paperwork, shipping, receiving, transfers, markdowns and general organization.

Qualifications:

· Must have excellent customer service skills.

· Strong organizational skills

· Good communication and interpersonal skills.

· Must be able to multi-task and prioritize.

· Must have flexible schedule.

· Must have a minimum of 2 years of retail leadership experience

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)

title: After-School Coordinator GUG LIC
description:
**Job Title:** Site Coordinator

**Organization:** Legacy Youth Organization

**Location:** Growing Up Green Charter School Elementary

39-27 28th St Long Island City NY 11101

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday, 2:30PM - 6:00 PM

**Pay:** $17.00 - $19.50 per hour

**Job Type:** Part-time / Contract

**Job Summary:**

Legacy Youth Organization, a community-based organization offering after-school programs for elementary school students, is seeking an organized and creative Site Coordinator. The ideal candidate will be a knowledgeable and professional team player who can build warm relationships with students and their families. We are looking for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit who can manage the program's operations and adapt to new situations with integrity and success.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Program Management:** Oversee the day-to-day operations of the after-school program, ensuring a safe and positive environment for all participants.
* **Supervision:** Provide close supervision of all activities to ensure the health, safety, and wellbeing of students.
* **Team Leadership:** Manage and support Activity Specialists, ensuring the successful implementation of the daily schedule and program activities.
* **Documentation:** Maintain accurate program records using our app, including incident reports, behavior reports, attendance logs, and sign-in/sign-out sheets.
* **Student Support:** Observe and assess individual student needs, addressing any issues that arise with care and professionalism.
* **Resource Management:** Ensure the availability and safety of supplies and equipment. Manage inventory and request monthly purchase orders as needed.
* **Parent Communication:** Build and maintain positive relationships with parents and guardians, providing regular updates on their child’s strengths and areas for growth.
* **Coverage:** Provide coverage for Activity Specialists as needed.
* **Reporting:** Submit snack rosters to the DOE as required.

**Work Relationships:**

* Reports to the Director of Citywide Programs.
* Collaborates with students, site staff, families, and program managers.

**Qualifications:**

* Must be punctual, friendly, motivated, and alert.
* Enjoys working in a team environment.
* Able to be flexible and manage stressful situations effectively.
* Must be over 21 years old.
* **Experience:** At least 2 years of experience in childcare (Preferred).

**Work Location:** One central location.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $17.00 - $19.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 25 per week

Schedule:

* After school
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a working iPhone with active cellular service?
* Can you provide an example of a time when you had to address a student-related issue or conflict? How did you handle the situation, and what was the outcome?
* Describe a time when you had to communicate with parents or guardians about a sensitive issue regarding their child. How did you approach the conversation, and what strategies did you use to maintain a positive relationship?
* How do you manage and prioritize multiple tasks and responsibilities in a fast-paced environment, especially when unexpected challenges arise?
* Site Coordinators are required to work during the after-school hours of 1:45 pm- 6:00 pm Monday - Friday. Are you able to commit to this schedule?

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

Experience:

* Childcare: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Counselor for Staff Support
company: South Bronx Community Charter High School
description:
South Bronx Community Charter High School (SBC) is seeking a dedicated and compassionate counselor to support the mental health and well-being of our teachers and staff. As an integral part of our educational community, the counselor will play a vital role in creating a positive work environment that fosters empathy, collaboration, and continuous professional development.

**Key Responsibilities and Accountability:**

*Collective Staff Wellness*

* Collaborate with school leadership and human resources to develop and implement wellness programs and initiatives tailored to the needs of educators.
* Offer workshops and training sessions on stress management, self-care, resilience-building, and other topics relevant to teacher well-being.

*Small Group and Individual Staff Support*

* Provide individual and group counseling sessions to teachers and staff members, addressing secondary trauma, burnout and promoting emotional well-being.
* Develop and maintain resources and referral networks for mental health services, ensuring that teachers and staff have access to appropriate support when needed.

*Community Engagement and Advocacy*

* Serve as an advocate for increasing access to mental health services for teachers and school staff across the city and state.
* Engage with local elected officials, participate in the local Community Education Council, and build partnerships with community organizations to raise awareness about the importance of supporting educator well-being.

**Other duties as assigned**

**Core Competencies:**

* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build trusting relationships with teachers, staff, and stakeholders.
* Knowledge of trauma-informed practices, crisis intervention techniques, and evidence-based therapeutic modalities.
* Commitment to advocating for the well-being of educators and promoting a culture of mental health awareness and support.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Master's degree in counseling, social work, psychology, or a related field.
* Licensed or eligible for licensure as a mental health counselor or social worker in the state of New York.
* Experience providing counseling or mental health support in an educational setting is preferred.
* Commitment to SBC’s core values and education approach

**Salary:**

* Minimum compensation of $75,000
* Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits
* 403b retirement savings account
* 3 weeks paid vacation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching

* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

title: Assistant Center Manager Plasma Donation Center
description:
**Assistant Center Manager Plasma Donation Queens Center – In person**

Olgam Life is a plasma donation service offering state-of-the-art treatment of donors while providing life-saving resources for the medical industry. Our commitment to the highest standards is absolute, from the time the client walks in the door to the moment the plasma leaves our facility. Olgam Life focuses solely on the aggregation aspect of the donation process, enabling us to focus more closely on the care our donors receive.

**Job description**

This position is reports to the Center Manager and will assist with oversight and day-to-day operations of an Olgam Plasma Center location. The Assistant Center Manager will ensure the center is functioning in a manner to achieve operational, compliance, and regulatory objectives as determined by Olgam Life.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities**

· In alliance with Center Quality, maintains a state of compliance ensuring the center remains audit ready.

· Manages the center budget to align with forecasted targets.

· Drives Key Performance Indicator (KPI) goals to meet production and quality performance measures.

· Manages the development and growth of approximately 30 center personnel to ensure expansion of knowledge and competencies related to the operational activities of the business in a fast paced environment.

· Has ultimate oversight to all center processes including but not limited to, production flow, facility maintenance, equipment maintenance, supply and inventory management, employee relations, customer complaints, compliance and regulatory programs, training programs, product management, and medical management.

· Leads center specific projects to ensure all requirements are met.

· Maintains skills in all technical/production areas of the center.

· Other duties as assigned by operational Leadership

**Requirements**

· B.S./B.A degree required. Also, acceptable educational requirements include Degree or Certificate in Business Management or Organizational development. Education may be substituted for experience as described below.

· A minimum of 2 years’ experience as a people manager is required; or 2 years’ experience working in a regulated environment is preferred

· Must be able to work independently with minimal direct oversight.

· Able to evaluate and interpret regulations and recognize the need for appropriate changes relative to business operations.

· Organizational skills and attention to detail

· Good verbal and written communication skills

· Professional communication and the ability to inform and report appropriately to

· executive leadership

· Scheduling flexibility to ensure appropriate center support and coverage

· Ability to execute multi-step technical driven tasks

· Familiarization with electronic systems/platforms used to organize, track, and execute tasks

· Ability to travel up 25% as needed

**Benefits:**

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance
* Bonus Opportunities

Pay: $65,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

title: Elementary Teacher (K-6)
description:
Talent Vision, a leading Staffing and Consulting firm, is partnering with a reputable charter school in Bronx, NY, to fill the position of Certified Elementary Teacher for an immediate start. As a Certified Elementary Teacher, you will play a key role in providing quality education and fostering elementary school students' academic and social development. Your passion for teaching, ability to create an engaging learning environment, and dedication to student success will contribute to a positive educational experience for all students.

**Specific Responsibilities**

* Implement curriculum and activities to meet our high academic standards.
* Analyze assessments measuring progress towards these standards and use this data to inform and differentiate instructional practices.
* Focus constantly on student learning, thinking critically and strategically to respond to student learning needs.
* Create a positive, structured learning environment to ensure that students observe the school’s core values, high expectations, and code of conduct.
* Communicate effectively with students, families, and colleagues.
* Commit to continual professional growth, participating actively in our annual, three-week staff orientation training in August and instructional training throughout the school year.
* Participate and support grade-level activities and school-wide functions throughout the school year.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in Education or a related field is required.
* Valid teaching certification for elementary school is required.
* Prior teaching experience is preferred.
* Passion for teaching and a genuine commitment to student success.
* Strong knowledge of subject matter and curriculum standards for elementary school.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to create a positive and supportive learning environment for all students.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues, administrators, and parents/guardians.
* Flexibility and adaptability to meet the needs of students and respond to changing circumstances.
* Proficiency in using technology to enhance instruction.

title: Treasurer
description:

**Position**: District Treasurer, 12-month position

**Job Description**: The District Treasurer performs accounting responsibilities relating to purchasing, payroll, budget and financial functions requiring the candidate to possess knowledge of business, computer and NYS Municipal accounting principles. title: Political Coordinator, New York
description:
Job Posted:


August 20, 2024  



**About Us**
------------


The Committee of Interns and Residents (CIR) is the largest house staff union in the United States. We are a local of the Service Employees International Union (SEIU), representing over 33,000 resident physicians who are dedicated to improving residency training and education, advancing patient care, and expanding healthcare access for our communities. CIR’s mission is to empower our nation’s interns, residents and fellows to fight for excellence for our patients.


**Job Details**
---------------


Full Time

* New York Metropolitan Area
* Posted 35 mins ago
  


**CIR SEIU**
### **Job Description**



The Committee of Interns and Residents is looking to fill a Political Coordinator position in the New York Metropolitan area. CIR is committed to fully engaging our physician-members on hospital worksite and CIR issues. To accomplish this, we need a highly driven and committed individual who has strong interpersonal communication skills and can effectively solve problems. This role will implement the Political Education (COPE) program. You will work closely with the Government Relations Director to ensure an understanding and active participation in the political process. You will engage with field staff and members to plan campaigns, lobbying, and attend events for our public endorsements at a city, state and federal level. The Political Coordinator reports to the Government Relations Director.


### **What You’ll Do**


* Drive the local level political and COPE program. Lead our union’s COPE program, endorsement of political candidates, recruitment to build COPE Boards, assist with staff and member training to meet COPE goals and raise awareness of the COPE program
* Work closely with the Legislative Affairs Manager on legislative priorities, member engagement and campaigns
* Provide support to staff for the recruitment, training, leadership development, and coordination of member political activists for political fundraising and electoral campaigns
* Provide support on issue campaigns, contract bargaining, and other political union activities
* Participate in community and political events to endorse and show support for local elected leaders
* Collaborate with the Government Relations Director, field staff, and organizing staff to integrate political strategy into planning for contract and organizing campaigns
* Help build and maintain relationships with elected and other public officials to support the local’s and members’ contract bargaining and new organizing priorities
* Empower our members to build effective advocacy relationships with elected officials, community partners, and other stakeholders
* Assist in mobilization of elected and other public officials in support of member actions, events, and issues
* Provide support to staff for the recruitment, training, leadership development, and coordination of member political activists for political fundraising and electoral campaigns
* Execute political activities such as voter registration drives, vote-by-mail, and GOTV activities
* Represent CIR at Central Labor Councils and State Council committees based on the recommendation of the CIR State Council E-board member

### **What Makes a Great Candidate**


* Bachelor’s degree in political science, public affairs or public administration
* Must have labor union, state or local agency or association, non-profit community organization, or progressive elected official experience
* Healthcare experience preferred, but not required
* Exceptional communication (verbal and writing) and follow-up skills
* Ability to listen actively and frame issues for members, electeds and other public officials
* Ability to evaluate and analyze information, and deal with conflicting/changing priorities
* Ability to think strategically and exercise a high level of judgment
* Energetic self-starter who thrives in fast-paced environments
* A team player who has a positive attitude and excels at collaboration and working cross-functionally
* Strong ability to connect and communicate with people of diverse backgrounds, including union members, union staff and leaders, elected officials, other communities and issue stakeholders
* Willing to work outside normal business hours, including evenings and weekends as needed
* Must have a valid driver’s license and ability to travel regionally
* Ability to travel throughout the country frequently and for long periods of time
* Working knowledge of membership databases
* Proficiency with Microsoft applications (Word, Excel); Google products such as Gmail and Google Drive (Docs & Sheets)
* Must be fully vaccinated for Covid

### **CIR Offers**



Competitive salary ($97,056 – $113,149) commensurate with experience and in compliance with the staff collective bargaining agreement.



Excellent benefits package including health, dental, and vision coverage with no employee contributions; generous paid leave time including four weeks’ vacation within the first calendar year of employment, paid holidays, personal days, and sick days; short and long-term disability insurance; 401(k); defined benefit pension plan; and mileage reimbursement.



In addition to a resume, please include a cover letter that explains your reason for wanting to work for CIR, an example of how you demonstrated success in a similar position, and a description of how this position fits into your long-term career plan. Please send your resume and cover letter along with 3 professional references to jobs@cirseiu.org with the Subject Line: **Political Coordinator – New York**.


*CIR is committed to equal opportunity for all employees and applicants and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. As a proud Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), we do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, religion, sex, sexual stereotyping, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws.*

title: VP, Recommendation Science, Media Group Decision Sciences
description:
**Company Description**  

We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.


Here you can be your authentic self. As a company uniquely positioned to educate, entertain and empower through our platforms, Comcast NBCUniversal stands for including everyone. Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiatives, coupled with our Corporate Social Responsibility work, is informed by our employees, audiences, park guests and the communities in which we live. We strive to foster a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture where our employees feel supported, embraced and heard. Together, we’ll continue to create and deliver content that reflects the current and ever-changing face of the world.

 **Job Description**  

Our Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) portfolio is a powerhouse collection of consumer-first brands, supported by media industry leaders, Comcast, NBCUniversal and Sky. When you join our team, you’ll work across our dynamic portfolio including Peacock, NOW, Fandango, SkyShowtime, Showmax, and TV Everywhere, powering streaming across more than 70 countries globally. And the evolution doesn’t stop there. With unequalled scale, our teams make the most out of every opportunity to collaborate and learn from one another. We’re always looking for ways to innovate faster, accelerate our growth and consistently offer the very best in consumer experience. But most of all, we’re backed by a culture of respect. We embrace authenticity and inspire people to thrive.


Are you ready to go beyond classic predictive analytics to new areas like deep learning and reinforcement learning? Do you want to be a part of the team that builds an advanced recommender engine, active learning platform, personalized solutions for product, marketing, and advertisement? Join the world-class international team of smart, hungry, and fearless professionals who are working at the cutting edge of technology and science at the epicenter of content, technology, and culture.


As part of the Media Group Data Science team, the VP, Recommendation Science will be a strategic partner in collaboration with Product and Technology to deliver industry-defining personalization. They will provide leadership and mentorship for a team of data scientists in the design and execution of advanced personalization models and heuristics, including but not limited to, content recommendations, product experience personalization, GenAI-based image and text personalization, and personalized ad services. They will further provide guidance and support for cross-functional team of architects, analysts, ML Engineers, and software developers as they integrate personalized data products and capabilities across our suite of global and domestic products. This is a dynamic cohort of high-caliber, opinionated leaders across Product, Technology, Marketing, and Content Discovery committed to building a state-of-the-art real-time video streaming service

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

* Build and strategically lead a high-performance team of data scientists in an experimentation-led environment.
* Lead the data science team in the development of a recommendation system modeling and experimentation framework.
* Work with business stakeholders to define priorities, best approaches and business requirements for analytical and experimentation solutions.
* Lead work with engineering teams to define data science driven requirement and solutions for major initiatives and opportunities of the streaming service functionality.
* Drive innovation of the statistical and machine learning methodologies and tools used by the team. Lead improvements in machine learning lifecycle infrastructure.
* Drive a data science culture that inspires and motivates the team to succeed.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Advanced (Master or PhD) degree with specialization in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Operations Research or another quantitative field or equivalent.
* Minimum 10 years of combined experience in software development, analytics, or data science
* Experience with commercial recommender systems or a lead role in an advanced research recommender system project.
* Demonstrable experience with deep learning, including computer vision, computational linguistics/conversational AI, or recommender systems.
* Good understanding of algorithmic complexity of model training and testing, particularly for real-time and near real-time models.
* Proven ownership and entrepreneurship enabling and leading high performing cross-functional experimentation programs.
* Proficiency in Python.

**Desired Characteristics:**

* Experience in content streaming or commerce as a senior contributor to AI/ML-powered product features and user experiences.
* Experience with reinforcement learning based systems.
* Knowledge of enterprise-level digital analytics platforms (e.g. Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.).
* Experience with large-scale video assets.
* Ability to build trust across the organization and socialize solutions and identified data insights.
* Go, Scala, or Java is a plus.
* Cloud certification (with exam) in either solutions architecture or Machine Learning from AWS, Google, Microsoft, or other major cloud software provider


Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.

*This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the* *Benefits page* *of the Careers website.* **Salary range: $250,000-$300,000 (bonus & LTI eligible)**

 **Additional Information**  

NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants  

and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity  

or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual  

orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed  

services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the  

right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your  

ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can  

request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.
