title: Department Chair History
description:
**OUR MISSION**

Innovation nurtures and develops students to be academically successful, socially mature, emotionally healthy, and equipped to lead self-directed and fulfilling lives. We welcome all students and we empower them to adapt, excel, innovate and lead. By instilling the core values of collaboration, tolerance, respect, activism, safety and innovation, students will graduate prepared for success in college and careers.

**Department Chair**

**Job Description** 

**Summary of Role**

The History Department Chair is primarily concerned with the improvement of learning opportunities through the provision of curriculum design, development, and evaluation within the assigned academic department. The DC collaborates with the instructional leadership team to promote the delivery of the written curriculum in support of the charter’s vision, mission, and goals. As the supervisor for the department, the DC has the role of decision-maker, consultant, and specialist in advising administrators, teachers, and other professional personnel on curricular matters. Key responsibilities include curriculum development, instructional coaching, and staff development.

**Major Duties and Responsibilities**

* Teach 3 classes and perform the associated duties of a classroom instructor for the assigned department including:
* Create and implement lesson plans based on Innovation’s 3-tier model of core curriculum, hands-on, experiential learning, and project-based learning
* Work closely with peers and administration to develop multifaceted curriculum that integrates multiple subjects and approaches and provides opportunities to develop student leadership
* Take an entrepreneurial approach to your curriculum, teaching methods, and optional duties
* Maintain an awareness of school’s strategic initiatives and incorporate them into your work, including working with partner organizations
* Regularly and accurately report student progress and maintain accurate and up-to-date records via the Student Information System
* Review data daily and amend your approach accordingly
* Take an active role in your professional development by identifying and creating opportunities to expand your skills including peer review and the use of video to improve student learning
* Communicate frequently with students and students’ families via phone, email, home visits or face to face meetings
* Attend PTA meetings and take an active role in school-community outreach
* Provide instructional leadership that enhances articulation regarding curriculum alignment with standards, the development and implementation of common assessments, and the use of effective instructional strategies that will most appropriately meet the needs of students.
* Manage the department in a manner that promotes positive and productive relationships between colleagues, students, parents and community.
* Monitor the curriculum that is being taught in the classroom by the department members.
* Demonstrate a willingness to examine and implement change necessary to produce efficient and effective systems and increase student achievement.
* Direct the planning, development, field-testing, and assessment of curriculum by selecting, using, and interpreting evaluation data. Serve as a curriculum consultant to teachers within his/her department and the Principal.
* Provide leadership to department committees for new text adoptions, and recommend supplementary materials for his/her department. Inventory textbooks and equipment as needed by the administration.
* Be knowledgeable in new trends and developments within his/her departmental content area, and recommend pilot or experimental programs for consideration and direct the provision of department-wide instructional-related staff development, including in-service training to support implementation of newly developed curricula.
* Supervise development of instructional guidelines, policies, regulations, and official notices, etc.
* Plan and implement staff development programs for department staff. Assist new teachers in methodology, technique, materials, or any other function needed to enhance the new teacher’s ability to be successful
* Manage the preparation of department budget requests and monitor expenditures.
* Assist in recruitment, staffing, and department HR activities (makes recommendations for staffing, teaching assignments, hiring/firing staff to the Principal and/or their designee.
* Assist the Instructional Leadership Team in developing Summer School student rosters, curriculum and staffing plans.
* Assist with the coordination of transition strategies, supports, and programs for students to successfully adapt to the rigor of high school core curriculum and make recommendations for the master schedule.
* Consult with parents, program teachers, school administrators, and other relevant individuals to enhance their work with students.
* Articulate the charter’s vision, mission, and goals related to instructional programs and services to the community and enlist the community to support high-quality instruction
* Observe the instruction of department members to provide assistance in classroom management, development of lessons, or any other area related to classroom teaching.
* Conference with the teacher and make constructive recommendations.
* Assist campus administration in implementation of MAP, Regents administration and ensure (in consultation with SpED staff) appropriate accommodations for all students.
* Perform other related duties as assigned by the Principal, and/or their designee.

**Supervisory Responsibilities**

Collaborates with the Principal on the staffing, supervision, and evaluation for the assigned curricular department.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

Broad knowledge of the principles and practices of the content area and of current trends in curriculum and instruction; comprehensive knowledge of the methods, materials, procedures, and practices of the specialties assigned to the department; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff and students; ability to manage fiscal, physical, and human resources to successfully carry out the function and programs of the department; ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. *Content related NYS Teacher certification is required.*

**Immediate Supervisor**

The Principal and/or their designee.

**Evaluation**

Performance is formally appraised during evaluation cycles that occur at least one time during the school year. Appraisals are transparent, collaborative, intended to promote professional growth, and based on accomplishment of the goals and responsibilities outlined above.

**Salary & Benefits**

This is a full-time position. Salary range is $80,000 to $110,000 annually, depending on experience. Innovation offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, Paid Family Leave, and a 401k retirement plan with an employer matching contribution up to 5%.

title: After-School Activity Specialist GUG LIC
description:
The **Activity Specialist** will be an experienced and energetic individual who will provide supervision to the after-school classes and support the after-school program. An Activity Specialist has skills or talents that are the focus of the activity. Activities can include art, dance, Zumba, STEM, literacy, nutrition, or organized sports. The Activity Specialist will facilitate activities but is not limited to homework help, arts & crafts, sports, health & fitness, nutrition, dance, and STEM education.

**Rate of pay:** $16.50-18.00

**Job Title:** Activity Specialist

**Organization:** Legacy Youth Organization

**Locations:**

* **Growing Up Green LIC 39-27 28th St Long Island City**

**Work Schedule:** Monday - Friday, 3:00 PM - 5:45 PM

**Pay Rate:** $16.50 - $18.00 per hour

**Job Summary:**

Legacy Youth Organization, a community-based organization that provides after-school programs for elementary school students, is seeking an experienced and energetic Activity Specialist. This individual will be responsible for supervising and facilitating after-school classes and supporting the overall program. The ideal candidate will have skills or talents in areas such as art, dance, Zumba, STEM, literacy, nutrition, or organized sports.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Supervision:** Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of all participants by providing close supervision during activities.
* **Activity Facilitation:** Lead and participate in a variety of recreational and educational activities, including but not limited to homework help, arts & crafts, sports, health & fitness, nutrition, dance, and STEM education.
* **Program Support:** Assist in the planning and implementation of age-appropriate and themed activities that engage and inspire students.
* **Homework Assistance:** Provide academic support during homework sessions, helping students with their assignments and guiding them in their academic growth.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work cooperatively with peers, professional staff, and other departments to ensure the smooth operation of the program.
* **Resource Management:** Maintain and organize equipment, storage facilities, and inventory, ensuring that all materials are in good condition and accessible.
* **Documentation:** Assist with maintaining accurate program documentation, including incident, accident, and behavioral reports, as well as attendance and sign-in/sign-out sheets.
* **Consultation:** Consult with the Program Director when faced with difficult or unfamiliar situations, ensuring that issues are addressed promptly and effectively.
* **Professional Development:** Actively participate in all training sessions, designated meetings, and special events to stay updated and improve skills.
* **Reporting:** Maintain a close working relationship with the Program Director, reporting on delegated tasks and future assignments.
* **Time Management:** Complete all job-related tasks efficiently and make effective use of program time during scheduled working hours.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in working with youth, preferably in an after-school or recreational setting.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to create a positive and engaging environment for students.
* Ability to lead and motivate students in various activities.
* Reliable, punctual, and committed to the success of the program.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $16.50 - $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

* After school
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a working iPhone with active cellular service?
* How do you handle situations where students have differing levels of skill or interest in an activity? What steps do you take to ensure everyone is included and supported?

* Can you describe a time when you successfully engaged a group of students in an activity? What strategies did you use to maintain their interest and participation?
* Staff is required to work during the after-school hours of Monday- Friday 3:00PM-5:45 PM. Are you able to commit to this schedule?

title: IEP compliance coordinator
description:
**Individualized Education Program Compliance Coordinator**

**Job Description**

**Our Mission:**

Innovation (“Innovation”) Charter High School nurtures and develops students to be academically successful, socially mature, emotionally healthy, and equipped to lead self-directed and fulfilling lives. We welcome all students and we empower them to adapt, excel, innovate and lead. By instilling the core values of collaboration, tolerance, respect, activism, safety and innovation, students will graduate prepared for success in college and careers.

**Summary of the Role:**

The IEP Compliance Coordinator is responsible for the coordination, planning and preparation of compliance documents for students eligible for Special Education services. They manage the provision of all mandated services and work with the Chairperson of Special Education to evaluate special education staff performance.

**Key Responsibilities**:

* Responsible for the coordination, planning and preparation of compliance documents for students eligible for Special Education services.
* Act as school liaison with district Committee on Special Education (CSE) to schedule initial, triennial and re-evaluations, to facilitate weekly IEP meetings, and to ensure compliance with state and federal mandates
* Manage the provision and implementation of all mandated services
* Ensure compliance with IEP timelines of assigned caseloads.
* Facilitate projects, develop programs, and maintain project summaries and financial records related to federal Special Education and NYCDOE reports
* Manage the development, monitoring, and implementation of 504 plans.
* Assist teachers and staff in the completion of the IEP goals and objectives and behavior intervention plans for students.
* Submit accurate and complete lists, forms, reports and data requested by the CSE, DOE, and the school administration by due dates
* Coordinate any needed transition activities such as functional vocational evaluations and person centered planning meetings.
* Coordinate the beginning and end of year procedures for records transfers for IEP data. Lead the onboarding process of related service personnel and paraprofessionals and assess the effectiveness of the implementation of related services
* Collaborate with NYC Office of Pupil Transportation to coordinate special transportation needs of students
* Provide strategies, training, and supportive consultation to special and general education teachers to ensure that they are implementing IEPs in a manner that is compliant and consistent with federal special education laws and regulations, NYCDOE procedures, school policies and procedures
* Develop positive relationships with parents and families in order to support their active engagement in the IEP process.
* Assists in recruitment, staffing, and department HR activities (makes recommendations for staffing, teaching assignments, hiring/firing staff to the Principal and/or his designee.
* Assists with the coordination of transition strategies, supports, and programs for students to successfully adapt to the rigor of high school core curriculum and make recommendations for the master schedule.
* Consults with parents, program teachers, school administrators, and other relevant individuals to enhance their work with students.
* Articulates the charter’s vision, mission, and goals related to instructional programs and services to the community and solicits its support in realizing the mission of the programs.
* In collaboration with the SpEd Department Chair, observes teachers and provides them with assistance in classroom management, development of lessons, or any other area related to classroom teaching.
* Assists campus administration in the implementation of MAP testing, in Regents examination administration, and, in collaboration with the SpEd Department Chairperson, ensures that students receive mandated accommodations.
* Completes and submits the SpEd section of the NYC DOE Per Pupil Invoice based on a comprehensive assessment of special education enrollment data.
* Performs other related duties as assigned by the Principal, and/or their designee

**Minimum Qualifications** 

* Working knowledge of federal laws, state guidelines and district policies related to the implementation, evaluation, and monitoring of IEPs and SPED programs
* Two years of experience in case management, program management, or teaching in a public charter school or similar organization
* Masters degree in Special Education, Educational Leadership, Psychology, Counseling, Social Work, or a related field
* High proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Google Apps,
* Excellent organization, planning, and implementation skills
* Excellent communication and skills

**Required Qualifications** 

* Initial or Professional 7-12 SWD Certification
* Knowledge of SESIS

**Immediate Supervisor:**

The Principal and/or his designee.

**Evaluation**

Performance is formally appraised during evaluation cycles that occur at least one time during the school year. Appraisals are transparent, collaborative, intended to promote professional growth, and based on accomplishment of the goals and responsibilities outlined above.

**Salary & Benefits**

This is a full-time position. Salary range is $65,000 to $90,000 annually, depending on experience. Innovation offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, Paid Family Leave, and a 401k retirement plan with an employer matching contribution up to 5%.

title: Early Childhood Mental Health Consultant
company: Upper Manhattan Mental Health Center, Inc.
description:
**EMMA L. BOWEN COMMUNITY SERVICE CENTER**

**Also known as**

**UPPER MANHATTAN MENTAL HEALTH CENTER, INC.**

**The Emma L. Bowen Community Service Center is seeking an Early Childhood Mental Health Consultant to join our team. This position is a terrific opportunity for someone to gain additional experience and make a difference in the lives of our clients.**

**For over 45 forty-five years, our organization has provided mental health and holistic services in northern Manhattan for families, children, adolescents, and other adults including the elderly in a supportive and caring environment. We also have an out-patient and residential substance abuse program as well as a Therapeutic Preschool for 3-5 year olds.** 

**Upper Manhattan Mental Health Center is a Certified National Health Service Corps (NHSC) site.**

**For additional information about our organization and programs, please visit us on our website at www.bowencsc.org.**

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**Job Title:** **Early Childhood Mental Health Consultant**

**Job Location:** **Early Childhood Clinic**

**Hours:** **Monday – Friday;** **35 hrs./wk.**

**Union:** **Non union**

**Job Summary**

We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Early Childhood Mental Health Consultant to join our team. As a team member, Early Childhood Mental Health (ECMH) Consultant will conduct trainings for staff and provide mental health consultation regarding children with behavioral and/or social emotional needs at early childhood education sites surrounding Manhattan, Harlem, and Bronx area. The ECMH Consultant will develop and maintain positive working partnerships with staff, as well as families at the early childhood organizations. Responsibilities will also include supporting parents, conducting parenting groups, mental health screenings on children and referring children who need intervention beyond on-site consultation for additional services.

**Duties**

* Utilize a relationship-based model to coordinate and deliver regular onsite consultative services to partner community programs, providing guidance to professionals and caregivers to effectively understand and support children’s positive behavior and development.
* Promote high quality interactions and relationships with caregivers and community members who interact with young children.
* Create a shared understanding of the effects of trauma and adversity, including oppression, prejudice, discrimination, racism, and gender inequity on the developing brain.
* Support the mental health and well-being of adults who care for infants and young children.
* Connect and refer infants, families, and providers to programs, resources, and supports.
* Build relationships with other early childhood serving systems within a community.
* Assist with facilitating an evidence-based parenting curriculum, such as Circle of Security.
* Provide dyadic therapy to children and caregivers.

**Qualifications:**

* Master’s degree in a license-eligible mental health field such as social work, psychology or related field with a focus and strong experience in early childhood development, and trauma settings.
* Demonstrated knowledge, understanding, and expertise of child development, early childhood mental health, early childhood social/emotional screening and assessment tools, prevention and intervention techniques, and local resources.
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience in relationship-based professional development, technical assistance practices, and adult learning methods.
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with diverse and culturally unique populations.
* Proficient in use of Zoom, Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook), and other computer functions.
* Demonstrated skills in written and verbal communication including correspondence, reports, reflective supervision, etc.
* Proven ability to work independently, manage time, complete assignments, and meet deadlines in a shared office space and out of the office or via tele-commuting.
* Ability to adapt and be flexible in a constantly changing environment that adjusts to meet organizational and community needs.
* Demonstrated experience working as a member of a team.

Skills: Bilingual in Spanish/English

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $58,000.00 - $78,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10031 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10031: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Inside Sales Specialist - New York/New England
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Inside Specialist (New York, NY - Metro area) to drive new sales opportunity to generation through to closure for new and repeat business. Working remotely in a home-based office, the successful candidate will collaborate with the field-based sales teams to address the needs of each customer and deliver outstanding account management support.


**The Details...**

The Inside Sales Specialist will be responsible for generating and progressing sales opportunities from new customers, as well as working to ensure the retention and growth of existing customers by actively building relationships and delivering up to date product information.


Other responsibilities include:


* Qualifying incoming sales leads and nurturing to conversion
* Actively implementing outbound sales prospecting campaigns at the support of the marketing teams
* Delivering up-to-date technical product updates to prospective customers
* Driving sales opportunities to closure including quote generation and collaborating with Contracts team to complete terms and conditions agreements
* Adhering to standard methodologies for tracking, recording and detailing relevant commercial intelligence in CRM
* Implementing and sharing best practices for achieving key performance metrics

**What We're Looking For...**

A BSc degree and/or Masters (preferably in Life Sciences, genetics and genomics), a PhD may be advantageous but isn't required for the role. Ideally, you'll have prior sales experience, preferably inside sales and have worked with research/life science customers and you know your way around CRM systems, but not required.


You will have an understanding of current DNA sequencing technologies and their applications, strong communication and influencing skills and knowledge of the Life Sciences and Genomics market!


You will be an excellent team player and able to build positive relationships with others. Ideally, you have experience of working in a global team, and you're comfortable in a fast-paced environment.
 

**We are looking for candidates located within the New York Metro area.**

You have a positive approach with a can-do mindset and are able to use your initiative as well as exercise good judgement and tact.


If the above suits you, then come and join our disruptive, cutting-edge and high-tech company!


Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, color, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.


Employees based in the US have the option to choose healthcare benefits, participate in the company 401(k) plan and company match, we also offer short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, and commuter benefits to name a few.


The salary for this role is between $66,970 and $100,454 USD. The salary offered will reflect the skills and experience of the candidate.


Certain roles within ONT are eligible annual bonus and stock. These awards are allocated based on individual performance.


We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We select and employ candidates only in accordance with their merits, qualifications, and abilities to perform the duties of the job regardless of gender, marital status, race, religion, color, age, disability, sexual orientation, military, or veteran status. title: Real Estate Finance and Operations - MSREI - Analyst
description:
Real Estate Finance and Operations - MSREI - Analyst

Job Number:

 3257779


POSTING DATE: Aug 20, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
JOB: Asset/Investment Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Analyst

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley Investment Management (“MSIM”), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has more than 1,400 investment professionals around the world and $1.5 trillion in assets under management or supervision as of March 31, 2024. Morgan Stanley Investment Management strives to provide strong long-term investment performance, outstanding service and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations and individuals worldwide.  



Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing (“MSREI”) is the global private real estate investment management business of Morgan Stanley. One of the most active property investors in the world for over three decades, MSREI employs a patient, disciplined approach through global value-add / opportunistic and regional core real estate investment strategies. With 17 offices throughout the U.S., Europe and Asia, regional teams of dedicated real estate professionals combine a unique global perspective with local presence and significant transaction execution expertise. MSREI currently manages $52 billion of gross real estate assets worldwide on behalf of its clients.  


**Position Description:**



The individual will play an integral role in supporting all aspects of finance, reporting and operations for the North Haven Real Estate Funds (“NHREF”). This role would uniquely position the candidate to collaborate with global teams and senior management of MSREI. Attention to detail and strong financial and analytical skills are critical to success in the position, alongside the ability to multitask and efficiently utilize resources.  



The NHREF series are closed-end private equity funds that acquire value-add / opportunistic real estate and real estate-related assets globally. Its portfolios comprise all major asset classes and include equity investments in single assets, portfolios and real estate operating companies. The current active NHREF represent approximately $6 billion of global real estate assets under management as of June 30, 2024.

  


**Primary Responsibilities:**


Prepare/coordinate fund-level quarterly reports


Review fund-level financials and investor-level partner capital statements prepared by the fund administrator


Review management fee calculations


Review carried interest calculations


Prepare/coordinate annual Investor and bi-annual Advisory Committee materials


Prepare materials for quarterly internal working group meetings


Prepare response to routine and ad-hoc investor requests


Assist in the review of quarterly fund-level track record prepared by the fund administrator


Prepare ad-hoc analysis and management reports, as necessary


Investment team operational support



Audit and Compliance:


Support internal and external audit efforts to ensure a frictionless and efficient review process


Support LPA and side letter management / compliance, including expense management, reporting and communications



Liquidity monitoring:


Update weekly/quarterly fund-level liquidity model


Monitor liquidity availability, timing of investor capital calls/distributions, need for credit facility borrowings/repayments



Valuation:


Review Valuation Committee materials


  


**Qualifications:**


BA/BS required


3+ years of audit and advisory experience in major accounting firm, specifically in the sectors of private equity and real estate funds


Proficient in financial accounting and quantitative analysis


Strong communication skills


Advanced Microsoft Office skills including PowerPoint, Excel and Word


Strong attention to detail


Responsive to stakeholder needs, ability to work under pressure, and with flexibility, to meet tight deadlines


QUALIFICATIONS


Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.



It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).

  


**Wage Transparency Statement**



Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $100,000 and $115,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

title: Junior Data Scientist-Analyst
description:
Junior Data Scientist-Analyst

Job Number:

 3257325


POSTING DATE: Aug 20, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Other
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Analyst

DESCRIPTION


Junior Data Scientist - Non Financial Risk  

  

Company Profile  

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.  

  

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  

  

Department Profile  

Professionals within the Non-Financial Risk Division provide a wide range of services to our business units. They form the second line of defense for management of the firm's non-financial risks, which include Financial Crimes, market manipulation or abuse and Operational risk.
  

Non-Financial Risk (NFR) Data & Analytics function is responsible for designing and optimizing models, approaches and tools using advanced analytical techniques like supervised and unsupervised machine learning, time series and statistical analysis to help evaluate and monitor the non-financial risks.
  

  

Primary Responsibilities  

> Develop and maintain the capital planning models to satisfy various regulatory and internal risk management requirements (Basel/CCAR/ICAAP/Quarterly Stress Tests). This requires thorough knowledge of statistical analysis of financial data and a good understanding of the various macroeconomic or market factors that impact the evaluation of operational risk.  

> Deriving actionable insights from data and leveraging quantitative and statistical techniques such as Generalized Linear Models, and time series analysis.  

> Write high-quality model documentation compliant with the firm's internal model governance policy, audit requirements, and the industry regulation (e.g., FRB, OCC, ECB and PRA).  

> Closely work with stakeholders to provide regular ongoing model performance assessments, perform periodical production runs, review analysis results with senior management and provide recommendations.  

> Support dashboard building and any other automation efforts.

QUALIFICATIONS


Required Skills  

> Bachelor or Master's degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, financial engineering, physics, mathematics, economics)  

> Statistical skills such as regressions, bayesian statistics and simulations.  

> Mainstream data processing and modeling programming languages (Python, R, Matlab)
  

> Team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills  

  

Desired Skills  

> Data analysis using SQL, and low-code tools like Alteryx and Dataiku (Preferred)  

> Familiarity with Basel capital and Stress capital model framework, Global Financial Crimes or market abuse and manipulation controls (preferred)  

> Hands-on experience with regulatory model development practice in large financial institutions (preferred)

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.



It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).



Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $68,000.00 and $90,000.00 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

description:
Corporate Treasury Forecasting & Planning, Director/AVP

 3256954

EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time

DESCRIPTION



**About us:**  

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. We are focused on bringing together different backgrounds, experience and talents to deliver world class service. If you are a driven self-starter, client-focused, and eager to contribute to a leading Global Financial Services firm, please apply. We welcome all backgrounds and experiences, and no direct industry experience is require.

  

**Team Profile:**  

Corporate Treasury provides corporate finance advisory service to senior management and internal business units. It also optimizes the Firm's liquidity and capital base, manages the Firm's foreign exchange and interest rate exposure, and coordinates relationships with regulators, rating agencies, and creditors.  

  

The Treasury Forecasting and Planning Team within Corporate Treasury is responsible for managing the Firm's short-term and long-term funding and liquidity forecasting processes. The team also runs analytics on business line resource consumption to aid senior management in the funding planning process.


**We offer:**  

  

* Work in the Finance department of one of the world's top tier Financial Institutions and gain first-hand insight of our business

  

* A desirable compensation and benefits package including eligibility for an annual bonus

  

* Professional development opportunities including access to Morgan Stanley's world-class internal trainings

  

* Enriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancement

  

* A supportive and vibrant diverse environment, we are inclusive of individual backgrounds and leverage them to foster our work environment and culture

  

**You will:**  

  

* Develop a holistic view of the Firm's balance sheet and ensure both short-term and long-term funding needs are accounted for

  

* Develop analytics on business line resource consumption to aid senior management in the funding planning process

  

* Develop analytics related to optimizing the Firm's funding stack and liquidity positioning

  

* Provide a vision and direction to the tech development team and stakeholders to deliver software solutions used to manage forecasting & funding / liquidity usage reporting

  

* Maintain the team's risks and controls and associated documentation (e.g., policies & procedures)

  

* Manage what-if analyses and attribution of results

  

* Develop and mentor junior resources on the team

  

* Build effective working relationships with other key stakeholders within Corporate Treasury as well as the front-office business units, Controllers, Financial Planning & Analysis, and Risk
  


QUALIFICATIONS

**Qualifications - External**

**You have:**  

  

* 5-7 years experience with financial markets or financial institutions

  

* Knowledge of Bank balance sheet, funding products, liquidity risk and liquidity management is a plus

  

* Strong excel & quantitative skills

  

* Well-developed analytical capabilities, including ability to summarize complex business problems and detailed analysis with clarity and brevity

  

* An inquisitive and pro-active mindset with strong critical thinking skills

  

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; general ability to express clearly and concisely ideas and concepts in written and oral form

  

* The ability to build relationships across the firm; must be comfortable interacting with and presenting to senior management

  

* Self-motivation and an eye for detail

  

* The ability to mentor junior talent

  

* Diversity of thought and background

  

* Bachelor's degree in a Finance, Accounting, or Information Technology-related field is a plus


**What you can expect from Morgan Stanley:**

We are committed to maintaining the first-class service and high standard of excellence that have defined Morgan Stanley for over 85 years. At our foundation are five core values — putting clients first, doing the right thing, leading with exceptional ideas, committing to diversity and inclusion, and giving back — that guide our more than 80,000 employees in 1,200 offices across 42 countries. At Morgan Stanley, you’ll find trusted colleagues, committed mentors and a culture that values diverse perspectives, individual intellect and cross-collaboration. We Firm is differentiated by the caliber of our diverse team. While our company culture and commitment to inclusion define our legacy and shape our future, helping to strengthen our business and bring value to clients around the world. Learn more about how we put this commitment to action: morganstanley.com/diversity. We are proud to support our employees and their families at every point along their work-life journey, offering some of the most attractive and comprehensive employee benefits and perks in the industry.  



Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees. title: Infection Preventionist - Registered Nurse - RN
description:
**Infection Preventionist - Registered Nurse - RN**


**Come join us at Ozanam Hall Nursing Home of Queens!** A Faith-Based, Nonprofit, Short-Term Rehabilitation and Skilled Geriatric Care facility sponsored by the Carmelite Sisters for the Aged and Infirm, we've served the community since 1971. We are a place of life, a place of caring, and more importantly, a true home for our residents.



We are looking for an **Infection Preventionist - RN - Registered Nurse**.



**\\*\\* Pay range = $110K to $115K Annually \\*\\***


**Infection Preventionist - Registered Nurse - RN** **Qualifications:**


* Current licensure in the State of New York as a Registered Nurse - RN.
* Current CPR certification.
* Certification in Infection Control and Epidemiology or Certification of the completion of the “Nursing Home Infection Preventionist Training Course” by CDC.
* Minimum of one year of experience in nursing supervisory or nursing management in a Long-Term Care setting.


**Infection Preventionist - Registered Nurse - RN** **Job Summary:**


* Develop, implement and evaluate the Ozanam Hall infection prevention program.
* Develop an annual surveillance plan based on the population served, services provided, and analysis of surveillance data.
* Utilize epidemiologic principles to conduct surveillance and investigation.
* Develop, interpret and assist with implementation of infection prevention and control policies and protocols.
* Communicate infection prevention and control information and data to various committee and healthcare workers.
* Create periodic written and oral reports/recommendations to the Director of Nursing.
* Provide leadership, supervision and educational principles on infection prevention and control for staff.
* Make daily rounds throughout the facility to assure that personnel are performing infection prevention practices.
* Participate in the assessment and selection of residents to the facility related to infection prevention and control.
* Provide hands on nursing care as necessary, as directed and allowed based on IP’s scope of licensure.


*This is a brief overview of job responsibilities and not intended to be all inclusive.*


**Are you looking for a workplace that rewards your effort, provides the physical and emotional support you need, management staff that care, with consistent scheduling and excellent benefits?**


**Ozanam Hall can offer you:**


* COMPETITIVE COMPENSATION
* Health (Aetna) and HSA with employer contribution
* **Fully paid Dental and Vision insurance**
* **Benefits available 1****st** **of the mo. following 30 days**
* **Student Loan Forgiveness Guidance**
* Retirement Plan, Life and Disability Insurance
* A mission-based approach to providing nursing care


**Please consider joining our team working where** ***The Difference is Love***℠**!**


*Ozanam Hall is an Equal Opportunity Employer and adheres to a policy that prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, citizenship status, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected class.*



#OZINFPREV2024

#### **Experience**


Required* Certification in Infection Control and Epidemiology or Certification of the completion of the “Nursing Home Infection Preventionist Training Course” by CDC.
* 3 year(s): Experience in nursing supervisory or nursing management in a long-term care setting.

#### **Education**


Required* Associates or better in Nursing

#### **Licenses & Certifications**


Required* RN

#### **Skills**


Required* Management
* Infection Control

#### **Behaviors**


Preferred* Leader: Inspires teammates to follow them
* Functional Expert: Considered a thought leader on a subject

title: Barmetrix Liquor Inventory Auditor
description:
**Who is Barmetrix?**

At Barmetrix, we specialize in optimizing business profitability for bars, restaurants and hotels.

We conduct on-site bar audits and collaborating closely with our clients to minimize losses and boost profitability. With our assistance, inventory management becomes more efficient, allowing bar managers and owners to focus on core operations while significantly reducing losses attributed to waste, spillage, and theft.

**Attention Early Birds:**

This is a unique opportunity for you!

People interested in this position are responsible for inventorying stock at bars and restaurants using our proprietary technology. Auditors weigh products (e.g., bottles, kegs) and perform an accurate inventory count using a hand-held scanner.

We work Monday - Friday starting early (by 6am) and we’re finished around noon (depending on how efficient you are). You’ll have your afternoons and evenings to do as you please!

This position is part-time and may lead to full-time.

**What Does an Auditor Do?**  
We go into different BARS BEFORE THEY OPEN to count and weigh LIQUOR, WINE & BEER using a hand-held scanner, digital scales & laptop. Initially, you’ll go into a location as a part of a team, but as you progress, you may audit an entire location by yourself.

Once you’ve finished counting a bar's inventory, you’ll move on to the next location. The schedule varies, but you’ll typically audit 2-4 different bars each day. All locations are located within the NYC Metropolitan area.

As a condition of employment, you must have dependable transportation to and from each location, and a cell phone.

You will be reimbursed for parking expenses.

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Independently travel to different client bar/restaurant locations in the NYC metro area as assigned.
* Provide regularly scheduled inventory audits of all beer, wine, and liquor in the establishment.
* Perform an accurate inventory audit using proprietary computer technology and furnished equipment.
* Follow all guidelines, policies, and procedures, ensuring the utmost integrity, professionalism, and ethical conduct in every aspect of your role as a Barmetrix employee.

**Requirements:**

The candidate we’re looking for is a bit tech-savvy, has great organizational and communication skills, and can work with speed and accuracy. Prior experience working in a bar or restaurant is a plus, but not mandatory.

**Some physical work is required.** You must be able to:

* Move quickly through each storage section
* Lift a beer keg several inches off the ground & set it on a scale. (We’ll teach you how, but they can weigh up to 165 pounds)
* Work inside a chilled cooler for extended periods
* Stand, kneel, bend, twist, and/or lift for extended periods

**Other Requirements:**

* Strong organizational skills & attention to detail
* Reliability & punctuality (Up and out the door early!)
* Own or have access to dependable transportation in and around the NYC metro area
* A strong work ethic in individual and team work environments
* Ability to work well with Barmetrix staff, as well as with client staff.
* Must be willing to learn continuously and work at a \\*fast pace\\*!

***Important Note to all Applicants***

*Thank you for your interest in a career with Barmetrix Hospitality. As stated in the job description,* ***attention to detail is critical in this position, so be sure to read the entire posting.*** 

*Using your personal email address, please send an email with a RESUME & COVER LETTER to kris@barmetrix.com. In the email, please explain why you think you’re a good fit for the job opening at Barmetrix. Do not write a generic summary that works for any position or any employer.* 

***Applicants who fail to follow these instructions will be disqualified and immediately rejected.*** *Due to the high volume of responses, we cannot respond to all applicants.* 

*Qualified applicants will be contacted.*

title: PANYNJ - AEOC Emergency Management Analyst
description:
The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (PANYNJ) Office of Emergency Management (OEM) Agency Emergency Operations Center (AEOC) Analyst has the primary responsibility for maintaining situational awareness of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey facilities.

PANYNJ OEM is seeking a highly motivated professional who likes challenge; committed to delivering high quality work that can work in a fast-paced operations center environment, manage tasks and act as the main interface with Port Authority Leadership and internal and external stakeholders concerning ongoing operations.

· The AEOC Analyst receives information from diverse sources and proactively develop, collect, and vet initial and subsequent information

· As a part of the AEOC team, analyst assesses and regularly reassess the scope and impact of incidents (local, regional, national), keeping PANYNJ Leadership, PANYNJ managers, internal and external stakeholders informed by providing continuous operational situational awareness through Alerts, notifications, reports and specific situational briefing documents

**Qualifications:**

· Experienced in 24/7/365 working environments with extensive coordination/collaboration with multiple stakeholders from federal/state/local agencies

· Possess strong interpersonal skills and ability to multitask within different platforms to maintain situational awareness of current events or tasks pertinent to the customer and stakeholders

· Intermediate to Advanced skill sets in using personal computers and their applications such as MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and other basic programs that use internet and computer-based communication tools.

· Ability to analyze and interpret data, identify solutions, and exercise independent judgment.

· Patience and flexibility in responding to frequently changing requirements and/or management styles.

· Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work with diverse groups of people throughout all levels of the organization.

· Collects, Analyzes and Processes Data for action and reporting.

· Able to think critically and communicate highly complex information accurately, clearly, and in proper context while working collaboratively in an often-stressful team environment.

· Candidates should be comfortable with drafting and disseminating written reports and requests for information.

· Assist leadership by maintaining common operating picture for the PANYNJ

AEOC Officers must be able to think critically and communicate highly complex information accurately, clearly, and in proper context while working collaboratively in an often-stressful team environment.

Candidates should be comfortable with drafting and disseminating written reports and requests for information. The ability to confidently deliver clear and concise briefings is a key skill for this role.

**Compensation & Benefits**

CRA, Inc. and The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey offers a competitive salary, an outstanding benefits package and a professional environment that supports development and recognizes achievement.

Salary Range: $48,000 to $55,000

12- Hour Shifts: 7 AM to 7 PM and 7 PM to 7 AM

title: Program Coordinator - CASA
description:
Weston United is seeking a Program Coordinator for the Casa Renacer Supportive Housing program (60 Beds) to assist the Director with daily program operations and assume responsibilities for the program in the Director’s absence.

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**:

* Supervises Case Management staff.
* Coordinates a team of case managers delivering rehabilitative and restorative services to assigned caseloads of residents.
* Ensures that consumers are living in safe and clean environments.
* Participate in agency management meetings.
* Functions as a qualified mental health staff and as such writes the admission notes in the Case Record.
* Assists with the data entry of resident information on the MAVEN recording system.
* Lead in assessing the needs and strengths of residents and helps the assigned case manager work with residents to set goals and objectives.
* Review delivery of services and chart documentation to ensure it meets the standards set by the agency and other reviewing, licensing, certifying, monitoring, and funding entities.
* Ensures that clients are linked to all necessary ancillary services including psychiatric, medical and dental treatment, vocational and educational resources, and legal and financial entitlements.
* Ensures that regular communication with collateral providers occurs and is documented.
* Provides crisis intervention to ensure the safety of residents and staff.
* Provides individual supervision to case managers to help them perform services of training, assistance, support and related clinical interventions and document on minutes of supervision forms and submit copies to supervisor.
* Prepares performance evaluations and time and attendance records for assigned supervisees.
* Represents the agency at conferences and meetings of referral sources, treatment providers, and professional and community groups.
* Other duties as assigned by supervisors.

**Qualifications:**

* A BA in Human Services; Mastere's preferred.
* A minimum of 2 years of experience working with a chronic adult psychiatric population is preferred.
* Strong writing and communication skills are required, along with proficiency in using computers.

title: Handyperson
description:
Our stores depend on the Facilities Technicians to keep the entire building operation running smoothly and ensure a safe and clean working and shopping environment for employees and customers. In this role, you’ll work closely with the store and division maintenance team to execute vital preventative maintenance programs to ensure your store is in good repair and equipment is running smoothly. If you are looking for an opportunity to use your handyman knowledge and skills to provide incredible service to others, this could be the role for you!

What will I do?

* Continuously inspect both building and grounds, looking for repair opportunities, and ensuring a safe and clean work and shopping environment
* Perform simple repairs, replacements, and maintenance on basic parts including (but not limited to) case doors, shelving, fixtures, ceiling and floor tiles, carts, racks, gaskets, hinges, filters and basic plumbing/plumbing fixtures, and restroom facilities
* Perform basic painting/touching up of interior/exterior doors, office, walls, trim, etc.; assist with small in-house, divisional projects, or tasks as needed
* Collaborate with the store Maintenance team members and Store Leadership; execute a Preventative Maintenance program for store equipment and facilities; troubleshoot emergency issues while assist in coordinating and monitoring resources and resolutions

Required Qualifications

* Previous mechanical or related experience
* Experience with mechanical/technical projects including home improvements, remodeling, general repair/handyman work and effective and safe use of power tools
* Basic Computer skills/Knowledge

We’re proud to offer flexibility in scheduling so our employees can prioritize what is most important to them. With over 200 years of service to the baking industry, BakeMark is recognized as an industry leader and trusted partner for quality bakery ingredients, products, supplies and services. BakeMark is a manufacturer and distributor with 33 branches conveniently-located across the U.S. and Canada.

At BakeMark we appreciate our employees and their families and offer a competitive pay and a full suite of benefits:

* **Health, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance (Comprehensive healthcare benefits package, with many coverage options)**
* **401K (generous retirement benefits)**
* **Competitive Wages (lucrative commission opportunities)**

**Summary:** Our Sales Representatives are the backbone of the company’s growth in all market channels. As such, it is the responsibility of the Sales Representative to grow sales of the company’s products and services utilizing the approach, strategies and tactics prescribed by the Company.

***Essential Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications:***

* Responsible for the sales execution of the company initiatives to promote BakeMark USA’s strategy of achieving the and maintaining the dominant market share position in the baking industry by taking steps necessary to identify and obtain orders for 100% of the supply needs of these customers.
* Must be able to travel in a local territory approximately 90%-100% of the time. Overnight travel may be required.
* Experience in sales. Understanding of the sales process and dynamics.
* A commitment to excellent customer service. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Unequivocally motivated to win business opportunities and ability to work in a fast paced environment.
* Superb interpersonal skills, including the ability to quickly build rapport with both customers and suppliers.
* Experience using computers for a variety of tasks. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Outlook, and Internet.
* Must have, and maintain, a valid driver's license. Must maintain current auto insurance.
* One-year certificate from college or technical school; two years of hands-on bakery experience; two years of prior route sales experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* **Prior Baking / Food Manufacturer Industry experience highly desirable.**
* **Bilingual a plus**
* **Job Type:** Full-time Sales Representative. A detailed job description will be provided to qualified candidates during the selection process.

title: Driver - Childrens Village Shuttle Driver
description:
Reports To: Assistant Food Service Manager, Food Service Director  

  

RESPONSIBILITIES  

* Maintain a clean and valid driver's license.
* Drive the vehicle into position for loading and unloading.
* Load the vehicle with product in manner ensuring goods are properly and securely stowed.
* Communicate with office.
* Deliver and unload goods at required site.
* Obtain a receipt for goods delivered.
* Vehicle check must be done daily. Vehicle report must be completed and submitted weekly.
* Hand in all gas receipts/cards upon getting gas.
* Must maintain an odometer log daily.
* Totally responsible for daily cleanings of vehicle.
* No other passengers allowed in vehicle unless authorized by manager.
* Must adhere to all motor vehicle laws and regulations.
* Whitsons is not responsible for any traffic violations while you are driving the company vehicle and are on company time. If you receive a traffic violation, you will be responsible for the ticket.
* Must adhere to all location policies which include but are not limited to: time of delivery, parking, designated delivery areas and designated driving areas.
* Perform additional duties as assigned.

Work Schedule:
Food service: Monday-Friday 7:00am-11:30.am
Driver: Mon-Fri 12:30pm-5:45pm
Hours will vary
These hours include a 1 hour Lunch Break
**Payrate: $17.00/hour**
Requirements:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPETENCIES  

* High School diploma
* A driver's license appropriate to the class of vehicle being driven is required.
* One year of safe driving experience in professional environment
* On-the-job training is provided.

* Be able to lift up to 40lbs and move back and forth side to side


* Speak and read excellent English.


* Sit in vehicle for extended periods.


Stand for extended periods of time.  

* Must be cautious of bad weather conditions that can make driving hazardous.

Must be able to read a scale for packing foods.  

GENERAL REMINDERS  

* The customer is always right.
* Always wear proper uniform attire including hat.
* Uniforms should be kept clean and neat at all times.
* Present a positive image.
* Smile and acknowledge customers by making eye contact.
* General courtesy requires you to clean up after yourself.

Do not leave it for someone else.  

* We strive for 100% satisfaction.

This position is split between a food packing position and a driver's position.

title: Sales Representative/Customer Service
description:
**About Us:** Sparks Cleaning is a leading commercial cleaning company dedicated to providing high-quality cleaning and janitorial services to businesses across Tri-State Area. We take pride in our commitment to cleanliness and professionalism, and we're looking for a dynamic and results-driven Sales Representative to join our team and help us expand our client base.

**Job Description:**

**Position Overview:** As a Sales Representative at Sparks Cleaning, you will play a crucial role in identifying and acquiring new clients within the commercial cleaning industry. You will be responsible for building and maintaining strong customer relationships, understanding their unique cleaning needs, and presenting solutions that align with our services.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Prospecting and Lead Generation:**

* Identify and research potential clients within the target market.
* Develop and maintain a robust pipeline of leads through cold calling, networking, and other prospecting techniques.

**Client Consultation:**

* Schedule and conduct client meetings to understand their cleaning requirements and challenges.
* Provide professional advice and tailored solutions to meet their needs.

**Proposal and Quotation:**

* Prepare and deliver comprehensive proposals, including cost estimates and service packages.
* Collaborate with the operations team to ensure proposals align with our capabilities.

**Sales Presentations:**

* Deliver persuasive presentations to potential clients, highlighting the benefits of our cleaning services.
* Address client inquiries and objections effectively.

**Closing Sales:**

* Negotiate terms, close deals, and secure contracts with new clients.
* Achieve and exceed sales targets and revenue goals.

**Customer Relationship Management:**

* Maintain ongoing communication with clients to ensure satisfaction and address any concerns.
* Identify opportunities for upselling and expanding service offerings.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in B2B sales, preferably in the commercial cleaning or related industry.
* Strong communication and negotiation skills.
* Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work independently.
* Ability to build and maintain long-term client relationships.
* Familiarity with CRM software and sales tools is a plus.

If you are a motivated and enthusiastic sales professional looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity in the commercial cleaning industry, we encourage you to apply.

**Application Instructions:** Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant sales experience and why you are a good fit for this position.

title: Fitness Coach - Mendham, NJ
description:
**Be fit. Change lives. Have fun.**  

If you’re reading this, you’re probably a committed fitness professional who wants to inspire others to work hard to be the best they can be. You know how to motivate to get that one more Burpee, and know when to hold back to be sure workouts are safe and effective.  

If that sounds like you, then keep reading because OTF is looking for Fitness Coaches to lead our coach inspired, science backed and technology tracked workouts. We are looking for coaches who can make our members feel welcome, and that they’re an integral part of the hour you spend together. Coaches whose positive energy stays with a member long after they’ve left the studio, and they find themselves counting the hours till their next workout.  

Well, now’s your chance to join Orangetheory and start leading the best 1-hour full-body group workout. We’re hiring and here’s what you need to know about working in a company that exudes positivity, passion, expertise and growth.  

As a Fitness Coach you can expect to perform the following duties:  

* Leading and motivating members through pre-defined workouts
* Helping members set and achieve goals
* Making sure members are using correct form and offering corrections if they aren’t
* Understanding the science behind our workouts specifically, heart-rate focused training programs in general, and being aware of what the competition is doing
* Knowing how to use and demonstrate usage for every piece of equipment utilized in every workout
* Being a team player

Additionally, you’ll need to meet these requirements:  

* Being AED/CPR certified
* Hold and maintain a current fitness certification from an education company approved by Orangetheory Fitness

  

Specific job duties and selection requirements vary between Orangetheory studio locations and more details can be provided by the studio’s hiring manager if you are selected to move forward in the interview process.

title: Home Visitor
description:
Family Services of Westchester (FSW) provides mental health and social services that strengthen and support families, children and individuals at every stage of their lives. With 50 innovative programs, FSW serves 30,000 individuals annually in Westchester County, New York.

Founded in 1954, Family Services of Westchester is a private, nonprofit, non-sectarian social services agency.

FSW’s Head Start/Early Head Start is a federal government program that was created in 1965 to give preschool children from low-income families a “head start” on their readiness for elementary school.

**JOB SUMMARY:**

Family Services of Westchester is looking for a full-time Home Visitor for our White Plains, NY Head Start program. We are hiring for multiple locations throughout Westchester County.

**POSITION TITLE:** Home Visitor

**STATUS:** Full-time/Permanent

**SUPERVISED BY:** Maria Pilco

**PURPOSE:** Home-based services offer home visits and group socialization activities for parents and their children.

**DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Establish a caring professional relationship with parents
* Asist parents in obtaining parenting skills.
* Ensure health and safety guidelines for children.
* Plan and develop with parents an individualized program for the family
* Work with parents to strengthen the families' knowledge of child development
* Support parents with problem-solving

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**Education**

* Must have a Child Development Associate (CDA) **(Required)**

**Requirements**

* Bilingual
* COVID-19 Vaccination is required to work at the Family Services of Westchester. Proof of Vaccination against COVID-19 must be submitted ad a part of the employment application
* MUST BE AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES

There are a variety of benefits to joining Family Services of Westchester, an organization with over 65 years of history impacting vulnerable communities. In addition to the opportunity to connect with and help thousands of residents in Westchester County, FSW offers its employees an inspiring, diverse and team-based work environment with comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and 403(b) for full-time employees.

At FSW, we enjoy working in a collaborative, mission-driven environment and value the benefits of a diversified workplace that prioritizes our clients and the communities we serve. If you want to make a difference in the lives of thousands of people across the communities of Westchester, and if the position of Head Start Assistant Teacher speaks to your capabilities, experience and commitment to social service, please submit your resume and cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by phone and/or email.

*FSW is an equal opportunity employer.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.11 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* At FSW, we require proof of vaccination against COVID-19 to work at any of our locations. Are you able to show proof of vaccination against COVID-19?

Experience:

* Social work: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Associate/Membership Advisor - Clinton, NJ
description:
**Be fit. Change lives. Have fun.**  

If you mention fitness within moments of meeting someone...if you encourage friends and family to get off the couch and get active...if you know and enthusiastically share the importance of fitness as a part of a healthy lifestyle - well, we just may want you to turn your passion for fitness into a paying career.  

We’re looking for enthusiastic individuals eager to share our story and our success with everyone who walks through that door or who calls for more information or who expresses even the slightest bit of interest in improving themselves.  

Are you passionate, positive, and can talk to anyone? Do you thrive on being part of a team? Does your zest for being part of a world-class growing fitness company get you out of bed with a smile and determination to change more lives - physically, mentally, emotionally? Do you have excellent communication skills, whether face-to-face or on paper?  

Then keep reading. Here’s more of what the position entails:  

* Greeting everyone who enters the studio with enthusiasm, energy and knowledge
* Presenting the OTF concept to any interested consumers, also known as “intros”
* Working at our front desk which includes answering phones and talking to members among other tasks
* Giving studio tours
* Working hand-in-hand with trainers to guide intros through their first Orangetheory workout
* Selling memberships to help the studio thrive
* Following up on prospective clients
* Handling members’ concerns in a professional and objective manner with the goal of resolution
* Participating in marketing and outreach events
* Ensuring all areas of the studio are kept clean and organized

So if you have a passion for fitness and would like to help us in our mission to spread More Life to our members and community, we would like to hear from YOU!

title: Department Chair STEM
description:
**OUR MISSION**

Innovation nurtures and develops students to be academically successful, socially mature, emotionally healthy, and equipped to lead self-directed and fulfilling lives. We welcome all students and we empower them to adapt, excel, innovate and lead. By instilling the core values of collaboration, tolerance, respect, activism, safety and innovation, students will graduate prepared for success in college and careers.

**STEM Department Chair (DC)**

**Job Description** 

**Summary of Role**

The Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) Department Chair is primarily concerned with the improvement of learning opportunities through the provision of curriculum design, development, and evaluation within the assigned academic departments. The DC collaborates with the instructional leadership team to promote the delivery of the written curriculum in support of the charter’s vision, mission, and goals. As the supervisor for the department, the DC has the role of decision-maker, consultant, and specialist in advising administrators, teachers, and other professional personnel on curricular matters. Key responsibilities include curriculum development, instructional coaching, and staff development.

**Major Duties and Responsibilities**

* Teach 3 classes and perform the associated duties of a classroom instructor for the assigned department including:
* Create and implement lesson plans based on Innovation’s 3-tier model of core curriculum, hands-on, experiential learning, and project-based learning
* Work closely with peers and administration to develop multifaceted curriculum that integrates multiple subjects and approaches and provides opportunities to develop student leadership
* Take an entrepreneurial approach to your curriculum, teaching methods, and optional duties
* Maintain an awareness of school’s strategic initiatives and incorporate them into your work, including working with partner organizations
* Regularly and accurately report student progress and maintain accurate and up-to-date records via the Student Information System
* Review data daily and amend your approach accordingly
* Take an active role in your professional development by identifying and creating opportunities to expand your skills including peer review and the use of video to improve student learning
* Communicate frequently with students and students’ families via phone, email, home visits or face to face meetings
* Attend PTA meetings and take an active role in school-community outreach
* Provide instructional leadership that enhances articulation regarding curriculum alignment with standards, the development and implementation of common assessments, and the use of effective instructional strategies that will most appropriately meet the needs of students.
* Manage the department in a manner that promotes positive and productive relationships between colleagues, students, parents and community.
* Monitor the curriculum that is being taught in the classroom by the department members.
* Demonstrate a willingness to examine and implement change necessary to produce efficient and effective systems and increase student achievement.
* Direct the planning, development, field-testing, and assessment of curriculum by selecting, using, and interpreting evaluation data. Serve as a curriculum consultant to teachers within his/her department and the Principal.
* Provide leadership to department committees for new text adoptions, and recommend supplementary materials for his/her department. Inventory textbooks and equipment as needed by the administration.
* Be knowledgeable in new trends and developments within his/her departmental content area, and recommend pilot or experimental programs for consideration and direct the provision of department-wide instructional-related staff development, including in-service training to support implementation of newly developed curricula.
* Supervise development of instructional guidelines, policies, regulations, and official notices, etc.
* Plan and implement staff development programs for department staff. Assist new teachers in methodology, technique, materials, or any other function needed to enhance the new teacher’s ability to be successful
* Manage the preparation of department budget requests and monitor expenditures.
* Assist in recruitment, staffing, and department HR activities (makes recommendations for staffing, teaching assignments, hiring/firing staff to the Principal and/or their designee.
* Assist the Instructional Leadership Team in developing Summer School student rosters, curriculum and staffing plans.
* Assist with the coordination of transition strategies, supports, and programs for students to successfully adapt to the rigor of high school core curriculum and make recommendations for the master schedule.
* Consult with parents, program teachers, school administrators, and other relevant individuals to enhance their work with students.
* Articulate the charter’s vision, mission, and goals related to instructional programs and services to the community and enlist the community to support high-quality instruction
* Observe the instruction of department members to provide assistance in classroom management, development of lessons, or any other area related to classroom teaching.
* Conference with the teacher and make constructive recommendations.
* Assist campus administration in implementation of MAP, Regents administration and ensure (in consultation with SpED staff) appropriate accommodations for all students.
* Perform other related duties as assigned by the Principal, and/or theirdesignee.

**Supervisory Responsibilities**

Collaborates with the Principal on the staffing, supervision, and evaluation for the assigned curricular department.

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

Broad knowledge of the principles and practices of the content area and of current trends in curriculum and instruction; comprehensive knowledge of the methods, materials, procedures, and practices of the specialties assigned to the department; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff and students; ability to manage fiscal, physical, and human resources to successfully carry out the function and programs of the department; ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. *Content related NYS Teacher certification is required.*

**Immediate Supervisor**

The Principal and/ortheirdesignee.

**Evaluation**

Performance is formally appraised during evaluation cycles that occur at least one time during the school year. Appraisals are transparent, collaborative, intended to promote professional growth, and based on accomplishment of the goals and responsibilities outlined above.

**Salary & Benefits**

This is a full-time position. Salary range is $80,000 to $110,000 annually, depending on experience. Innovation offers an excellent benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, life insurance, Paid Family Leave, and a 401k retirement plan with an employer matching contribution up to 5%.
