title: Part Time Retail Sales Associate (Year-Round)
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

At Charles, you'll take on new responsibilities from day one, and become part of the illustrious Katonah community. Throughout the past century, the people that make up our brand – our employees and our customers, are rooted in the legacy that makes Charles what it is, and will continue to be into the future. If you want to be part of an historic business, and help lead the way for where we’re headed, we’d love to have you join us.

As a Retail Sales Associate, you will engage and connect with our customers by providing phenomenal customer service that contributes to the store’s sales and profits. You will always put the customer first, be an expert in product and use this expertise to educate, inform, inspire and outfit the customer. You’re expected to create an environment that is easy for our customers to shop, offer information to the customer on current merchandise assortment, store promotions and events, and execute operational processes effectively and efficiently. Our goal is to bring our store to life for our customers while building loyalty and delivering with productivity.

This role will work in accordance with Charles Department Store standards, policies, procedures, and legal requirements.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* **Year round availability needed**
* 4-5 days per week, 25-30 hours a week, 5-8 hour shifts
* Weekend availability needed, Sundays in November & December only
* Specialty retailing experience preferred.
* Proficiency operating computer systems, typing, utilizing the internet, and learning our point-of-sale system.
* Requires ability to move about in a store including standing, walking, kneeling, stooping, climbing ladders or step stools, using stairs, carrying, bending, stretching, twisting, or reaching out with the body, arms, or legs, pulling and lifting objects up to 25 pounds. Sometimes these movements are made quickly and repeatedly.

**WHO YOU ARE:**

* Outgoing and friendly with a passion for customer service.
* A multi-tasker who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment.
* Inclusive, positive, creative, and able to learn procedural knowledge acquired through on-the-job training.
* Self starter with a critical eye, able to complete projects as assigned, including stock assignments and keeping the selling floor to standard.
* Able to handle customer interactions and potential issues/concerns courteously and professionally in a timely manner.
* Possess the ability to utilize technology effectively and engage with customers and meet sales goals.
* Problem solver with a focus on continuous improvement, who is always learning, open to feedback and takes action as required.

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**

* Actively greet and engage with our customers on the sales floor to provide the best customer experience.
* Become an expert in the merchandise we sell, sharing expertise with every customer who walks through our doors, allowing us to provide a premium customer experience.
* Maintain professional appearance that reflects the Charles Department Store image.
* Acknowledge and assist customers; locate merchandise efficiently using various methods; answer questions quickly and accurately.
* Support in the maintenance of a neat and tidy sales floor to ensure a positive shopping experience inclusive of folding, hanging, displaying, and merchandising garments to maximize selling opportunities.
* Unload and log deliveries, receive, open, and unpack merchandise and label merchandise.
* Actively process, stock, and replenish inventory on the sales floor and stock room.
* Seek information about all new arrivals, including product knowledge about fit, color, model specifics, etc.
* Ring on the register, tag sales to customer profiles, handle all required transactions, issue receipts, and wrap gifts when necessary.
* Ensure exceptional selling interactions that guarantee meaningful experiences and build customer relationships.
* Follow all procedures and routines regarding safety, security, and administrative processes in all areas of the store.
* Share your knowledge and skills with your colleagues, offering help where needed to build a positive working environment.

**ABOUT CHARLES:**

Charles Department Store is a 4th generation family owned and operated independent specialty store located in Katonah, New York. Founded in 1924, Charles Department Store prides itself with a long tradition of personal service and a unique selection of handpicked, high quality merchandise. Complete with original tin ceilings and creaky wooden floors, Charles takes shoppers back to a time when retailers existed within a community and built their business one satisfied customer at a time.

“You can’t sell from an empty cart." *- Charles Raneri, founder*

**NOTES:**

This position description is intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by associates assigned to this job. It is not intended to be inclusive of all duties and responsibilities and is subject to change.

Charles Department Store is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have a long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging.

We, in good faith, believe that this posted rate of compensation is the accurate range for this role at this location at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future.

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 25 – 30 per week

Shift:

* Day shift

Ability to Relocate:

* Katonah, NY 10536: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Behavior Technician
description:
Job Overview:  
We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate Behavior Technician to join our team. As a Behavior Technician, you will provide direct support to individuals with developmental disabilities, implementing behavior plans and assisting with daily living activities. Your role will be crucial in helping individuals achieve their goals and improve their quality of life.

Duties:  
- Implement behavior plans developed by the Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)  
- Collect and record data on client progress and behavior  
- Assist with the development and implementation of individualized care plans  
- Provide direct support to individuals with developmental disabilities, including assistance with activities of daily living (ADLs)  
- Utilize applied behavior analysis (ABA) techniques to promote positive behavior change  
- Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to ensure coordinated care  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical documentation and records  
- Monitor and report any changes or concerns in client behavior or progress  
- Follow all safety protocols and maintain a safe environment for clients

Qualifications:  
- High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's degree in psychology, special education, or related field preferred  
- Previous experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred  
- Knowledge of applied behavior analysis (ABA) principles and techniques  
- Strong communication skills, both verbal and written  
- Ability to work independently as well as part of a team  
- Excellent problem-solving and organizational skills  
- Compassionate and patient demeanor

Benefits:  
- Competitive pay based on experience and qualifications  
- Opportunities for career advancement and professional development  
- Comprehensive training program provided  
- Supportive work environment with a collaborative team

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals with developmental disabilities, we encourage you to apply for the position of Behavior Technician. Join our team and help us create positive change!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Benefits:

* Paid training

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Applied behavior analysis: 1 year (Required)
* Working with adolescent children with disabilities: 1 year (Required)

description:

* Understanding of electrical fundamentals and electronic instrumentation.

title: Program Leader at After School All Stars (LEEP)
description:
**Program Leader**

**After-School All-Stars New York**

Part-time

**Qualifications**

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)
* Experience with Children: 1 year (Preferred)
* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)
* First Aid Certification (Preferred)
* CPR Certification (Preferred)

**Full Job Description**

**After-School All-Stars New York: Part-Time Program Leader**

After-School All-Stars (ASAS) is one of the leading national after-school program providers in the country. Our comprehensive school-based programs combine activities and learning to help build the knowledge and skills children need to succeed, both in school and in life. For the 2024-2025 School Year, we are looking for energetic, creative Program leaders who want to join our team.

Position: Program Leader

Work Hours: This is a part-time position. Typical hours are Monday – Thursday 3:00pm-6:00pm and Friday, 1:00pm – 6:00pm

Compensation: $17-19/hour depending on experience

Location: LEEP- 5323 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11220

**Responsibilities/ Duties:**

Program Leaders are responsible for monitoring and managing between 20 to 30 participants in and out of the classroom with other staff's assistance. Ideal candidates will be highly motivated, organized, and able to manage and engage in large groups.

Program Leaders are responsible for supporting Activity Specialists in executing quality pre-designed curriculum, support with behavior management, and be excellent team players and collaborators. They also must be keen observers and skilled in engaging youth. The role of a Program Leader can be broken down into three major areas of focus: Creating Positive Environments, Building Positive Relationships, and Designing and Delivering Positive Experiences.

**Positive Environment:**

· Recognize and embrace participants for who they are (current behaviors and beliefs) and encourage, invite, and welcome them to opportunities to expand who they are (future behaviors and beliefs).

· Create culture and traditions to celebrate participation and effort.

· Know the safety policies and procedures and keep them.

· Plan multiple opportunities for students to speak and lead in class.

· Be present with the students always.

**Positive Relationship**:

· Establish clear expectations and guidelines for appropriate behavior.

· Resolve conflict positively and communicate effectively.

· Ask students for their input, ideas, feedback, and opinions.

· Set healthy boundaries that model healthy adult behavior.

· Maintain professional and positive relationships with school staff, partners, participants, and parents.

· Treat participants and colleagues with respect always.

· Content includes experiential and inquiry-based learning, building critical and creative thinking, collaboration, and communication skills.

**Positive Experience:**

· Provide participants with the opportunity to give input, feedback, and suggestions for lessons.

· Allow participants to have leadership opportunities to plan and make decisions about course offerings, projects, and culminating events.

· Collaborate with Program Directors, Activity Specialists, and fellow Program Leaders to establish and maintain high quality programs.

· Attend professional development activities and meetings.

· Support student recruitment and promotion of the program.

**Data Management:**

· Maintain accurate attendance data and reports.

· Submit required data on time and accurately.

**Experience and Education:**

The successful candidate will have a year or more of non-profit or related youth development program experience. The individual will have a familiarity with and passion for working with low-income youth.

· Some undergraduate study is required; coursework in education, social or human services, child development, or related field is desirable.

· Individuals who may have experience in the following areas: Math, English, Business, Music, Dance, Computer Literacy, and Social Justice are highly desired.

· One or more years’ experience working in an after school, day camp, or community youth outreach setting, primarily of the middle school age is preferred.

· Experience creating lesson plans or multi-week curriculum preferred.

· Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with school district staff, program staff, parents, and community leaders.

· Ability to communicate effectively and demonstrate sensitivity to others as well as respond to critical incidents and act swiftly in emergency situations.

· Familiarity and experience with diverse populations and cultural competencies are strongly desired.

· Excellent organizational skills.

· Ability to work with electronic devices.

· Must clear School Aged Children Care Program requirements, Statewide Central Register of Abuse and Maltreatment (SCR) clearance as well as Medical, FBI Livescan, State background check and Tuberculosis Clearances

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $19.00 per hour

title: Executive Assistant to CEO (Temporary)
description:
**Qualification Requirements:**

* Available 24/7 through smart phone.
* Reading, writing and oral proficiency in the English language.
* Secretarial skills including but not limit to typing, work processing, dictation, and filing.
* Bachelors Degree in Communications or equivalent.
* At least 2 years of experience as an Executive Assistant to a CEO or top level Executive.

**Job Functions**

* The ability to organize and prioritize daily workload independently.
* The ability to create own correspondence as directed and when warranted.
* The ability to produce flawless, accurate work.
* The ability to work independently with little or no direction.
* The ability to follow-up on instructions and requests in a timely manner.
* The ability to meet deadlines.
* The ability to handle multiple assignments.
* The ability to process departmental invoices.
* The ability to handle pressure.
* The ability to answer telephones and handle inquiries or take messages to refer to appropriate party.
* The ability to handle typing and word-processing needs for the CEO as required.
* The ability to execute the tasks of the CEO.
* The ability to maintain accurate records.
* The ability to assist the CEO in maintaining accurate documentation for guest bills in preparation for approval.
* The ability to maintain up-to-date lists for various mailings.
* The ability to prepare mailings in accordance with timelines established in documents.
* The ability to organize legal paperwork.
* The ability to make travel arrangements.
* The ability to maintain the CEO’s calendar.
* The ability to respond to guest complaints and requests.
* The ability to assist in running local errands as requested.
* The ability to handle computer posting procedures and imputing as necessary.
* The ability to document meetings in minutes and process for review by the CEO.
* The ability to display a high level of professionalism and integrity at all times.
* The ability to manage and maintain payments for credit cards, utilities, property taxes and insurances and reconcile bank and credit card statements at the end of the month.
* The ability to manage and maintain personal insurances (car, boat, motorcycle and home).
* The ability to coordinate and manage in the planning of household special events (i.e., dinner parties, annual holiday parties, events).

title: Hybrid Registered Nurse - Pediatrics
description:
About Our Company
We’re a physician-led, patient-centric network committed to simplifying health care and bringing a more connected kind of care.
Our primary, multispecialty, and urgent care providers serve millions of patients in traditional practices, patients' homes and virtually through VillageMD and our operating companies Village Medical, Village Medical at Home, Summit Health, CityMD, and Starling Physicians.
When you join our team, you become part of a compassionate community of people who work hard every day to make health care better for all. We are innovating value-based care and leveraging integrated applications, population insights and staffing expertise to ensure all patients have access to high-quality, connected care services that provide better outcomes at a reduced total cost of care.
Job Description
Schedule: 9:00am - 5:30pm
Hybrid: Require 6 months in office presence and then will move to 3 days in office and 2 days remote
Essential Job functions:* Owning Phone Triage and Vaccine Administration for patients
* Overseeing patient education
* Assist the physician and staff with the daily coordination of patient care and physician access.
* Function as the liaison between patients, staff, and physicians.
* Maintains efficient patient flow.
* Delivers direct patient care within the scope of licensure and in accordance with SMG policy.
* Collects lab specimens according to departmental guidelines. Accurately labels specimens.
* Prioritizes patient care by implementing physician orders and nursing procedures.
* Ensures proper preparation for patient visit. Prepares pertinent information needed for patient visit.
* Effectively communicates problems, concerns or issues to the Office Supervisor/Manager appropriately and promptly.
* Assures all patients are correctly identified prior to providing and/or documenting care.
* Employs appropriate and timely use of Tasking in EHR.
* Obtains vital signs: BP, temp, pulse, height & weight accurately and completely as required. Documents appropriately in EHR.
* Administers injections according to appropriate protocol. Documents injections accurately in EHR.
* Appropriately demonstrates telephone triage protocols and document in EHR.
* Schedules appointments appropriately and accurately according to department guidelines.
* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Reviews and updates medication list in EHR. Demonstrates understanding of prescription control and prescription refill procedures. Accurately and completely documents known allergies in EHR.
* Appropriately enters orders and schedules appointments in the Practice Management System (PMS) and EHR.
* Provides referrals and/or consult orders appropriately and in a timely manner in the PMS and EHR.
* Checks and maintains logs for emergency equipment according to policy.
* Facilitates transition of care to UCC/Hospital.
* Maintains proficiency with department specific equipment troubleshoots and reports malfunctions promptly.


Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:* Associates degree required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.
* New York State Nursing License and BLS certification required.
* Connecticut State Nursing License (can be obtained once hired)
* 1 - 4 years experience preferred.
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing.
* Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
* Ability to perform diverse work assignments with time limitations with a high degree of accuracy.
* Ability to use problem solving, critical thinking and priority setting skills.
* Experience with Standard Office Equipment (Phone, Fax, Copy Machine, Scanner, Email/Voice Mail) preferred.
* Experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Experience with patient care equipment preferred.
* Experience with EHR, Practice Management System and Departmental/Ancillary Systems preferred.


Travel:* Ability to commute to satellite offices as needed.

*Pay Range $41/hr to $55/hr**The provided compensation range is based on industry standards and salary determinations will be made based on numerous factors including but not limited to years of experience and location of position.*

title: Digital Media/Leadership Lead Teaching Artist (Dock Street School - 19 Dock Street)
description:
**Digital Media/Leadership Lead Teaching Artist (Dock Street School - 19 Dock Street)**

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a creative and dynamic Multimedia and Leadership Teaching Artist. The ideal candidate will have a passion for working with middle school students and a strong background in multimedia arts. This role involves guiding students in the creation of their portfolios through various multimedia projects, fostering their artistic skills, and helping them develop a comprehensive body of work.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design and deliver engaging multimedia arts lessons that align with the program's objectives and curriculum.
* Collaborate with the program coordinator and other teaching staff to integrate multimedia arts into a well-rounded after-school experience.
* Instruct students in various multimedia techniques, including but not limited to digital art, photography, video production, graphic design, and audio editing.
* Facilitate workshops on artistic concepts, design principles, and technical skills to enhance students' creative abilities.
* Assist students in planning and executing projects that showcase their artistic growth and achievements.
* Provide personalized guidance and feedback to students as they build their portfolios, helping them select and refine their best work.
* Foster a positive and inclusive learning environment that encourages students to express themselves creatively.
* Encourage collaboration and teamwork among students, allowing them to share ideas and learn from each other's work.
* Organize showcases or exhibitions to display students' completed multimedia projects and portfolios to the school community.
* Maintain a safe and organized workspace, ensuring that all materials and equipment are properly utilized and stored.
* Communicate regularly with parents or guardians to update them on students' progress and upcoming projects.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Fine Arts, Multimedia Arts, Education, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
* Proven experience working as a multimedia artist or in a similar creative role.
* Strong portfolio showcasing proficiency in various multimedia disciplines, such as digital art, photography, video production, graphic design, and more.
* Experience working with middle school students or youth in an educational or mentorship capacity.
* **Proficiency in multimedia software and tools, including Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, etc.) and other relevant platforms.**
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to connect with students, parents, and fellow staff members.
* Passion for arts education and a deep understanding of how to nurture students' creativity and self-expression.
* Organizational skills to plan and execute lessons, projects, and events effectively.
* Patience, adaptability, and a positive attitude when working with students of varying skill levels.

**Application Requirements:**

* Resume/CV detailing relevant education, experience, and artistic achievements.
* Portfolio showcasing a diverse range of multimedia work.
* References from previous employers or colleagues who can speak to your teaching abilities and artistic expertise.

**COMPETENCIES:**

* High communication Proficiency
* Cultural Competence/Agility
* Design and curatorial skills
* Team Building
* Time Management
* Problem Solving/Analysis
* Project Management
* Ethical Conduct

*Required Clearances:*

* Department of Health fingerprint clearance
* Department of Education fingerprint clearance
* Statewide Central Register (SCR) clearance
* Physical examination

title: Service Advisor
description:
**Job description**

**Service Advisors** are to greet customers, listen to their description of the problems or service needed, determine the type of service required and prepare repair orders. If a vehicle requires additional repairs not covered in the original order, they estimate the additional cost and telephone the customer for permission to do the work. They also advise customers on other available services.

***Responsibilities:***

* Advises customers about necessary service for routine maintenance.
* Helps identify a mechanical problem by questioning the customer or doing a visual inspection or road test.
* Confers with customers about inspection results, recommend corrective procedures and prepare work order for needed repairs.
* Prepares a repair order showing time, cost and labor estimates for service.
* Writes a brief description of the customer’s concern on the repair order to help the technician locate the problem.
* Explains the work performed and the repair order charges to the customer.
* Handles customer complaints
* Schedules service appointments.
* Obtains customer and vehicle data prior to arrival when possible.
* Greets customers in a timely, friendly manner and obtains vehicle information.
* Test drives the vehicle with customer as needed to confirm the problem or refer to test technician.
* Refers to service history, inspects vehicle, and recommends additional needed service.
* Advises customers on the care of their cars and the value of maintaining their vehicles in accordance with manufacturers' specifications.
* Provides a complete and accurate written cost estimate for labor and parts.
* Obtains customer's signature on repair order; provides customer with a copy.
* Establishes customer's method of payment. Obtains credit approval, if necessary.
* Notifies dispatcher of incoming work.
* Checks on progress of repair throughout the day. Contacts customers regarding any changes in the estimate or promised time, explains cost and time requirements in detail, and gets proper authorization before any additional repairs are performed.
* Implements and maintains a service marketing program.
* Reviews repair orders to ensure that work is completed, and additional work and authorization is noted. Closes repair order as appropriate.
* Ensures that vehicles are parked in assigned areas. Makes sure they are locked, and all keys are marked and put away correctly.
* Keeps service department forms, menus and pricing guides up to date.
* Implements a quality control process to eliminate comebacks.
* Maintains high customer satisfaction standards.
* Handles telephone inquiries regarding appointments and work in process.
* Inspects all vehicles for body work, informs customer if work is needed and provides an estimate for body work.
* Maintains a professional appearance.

***Benefits:***

* Vacation and Sick Time
* Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance
* Paid Holidays
* Career advancement and training opportunities
* 401K Plan
* Free Tuition through Strayer University

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

$23 to $25+ per hour *+ PAID Vacation, PAID Holidays & PAID Personal Days*

She normally naps at 9:00am and around 1:30pm for about an hour to an hour and a half. She has some food allergies but the family is seeing an allergist. She currently has two teeth emerging!

It would be nice if the nanny has some flexibility with the schedule during the winter months for rehearsals after school, but this is not a requirement. They are willing to pay through payroll. The dad works from home on Tuesday and Thursday. They do not need driving while the nanny is at work.

title: Geriatrician
description:
The Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai affiliated with New York City H + H/Queens (Queens Hospital Center) has an exciting opportunity for a full time Geriatrician in the department of Medicine.

New York City Health + Hospitals/Queens has served a culturally rich and diverse community for nearly a century. In 2007, the hospital opened an ultramodern Ambulatory Care Pavilion that hosts the Geriatric Service.

The candidate should be comfortable taking care of frail older patients with multiple comorbidities, have excellent clinical and communication skills, work well in a team, and enjoy teaching. The Department of Medicine at Queens Hospital Center believes in the importance of early geriatric education, reflected by having medical interns rotate through the Geriatric Service throughout the year.

The candidate will have the opportunity to work in our modern Ambulatory Geriatric Service, with a multi-disciplinary team of Geriatricians, nurses, social work, clerical and administrative staff. In addition, he/she will have the collaborative support of all the other specialties.

Candidates must have a MD degree and be board certified/board eligible with a valid New York State License, DEA and Medicaid number. Experience in research and/or quality improvement would be an asset.

We also offer a faculty appointment with the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai commensurate with credentials, experience and qualifications.

*The Mount Sinai Health System (MSHS) provides equal employment opportunity to all its employees and applicants for employment without unlawful discrimination on the basis of their actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, gender identity, age, disability, marital or parental status, sexual orientation, veteran, immigration, citizenship, or other protected status.*

title: Human Resources Clerk
company: Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP & Affiliates
description:
We invite you to review our current professional staff openings to learn about the opportunities available across the firm.  

About Us
Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP (Skadden) has forged a reputation as one of the most prestigious law firms in the world. By relying on innovation, intellect, teamwork and tenacity, our lawyers deliver the highest quality advice and novel solutions to our clients' legal issues. We are recognized as a global powerhouse for complex transactions, litigation/controversy issues, and regulatory matters, as well as for the open, collaborative relationships we build with clients. Our attorneys, who reflect diverse backgrounds and perspectives, collaborate seamlessly across 50-plus practices and 21 offices in the world’s major financial centers.
The Opportunity
We are seeking a Human Resources Part-Time Clerk to provide administrative assistance to the Human Resources Department. This position will be based in our New York office (on site). Please note that the Firm will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.* Handles standard administrative functions.
* Maintains personnel files and records including archiving at year end.
* Assists with storage and appropriate retention of HR files, both physically and electronically.
* Maintains orientation materials and department supplies, and ensures they are kept up-to-date.
* Assists with administrative projects, including purging of I-9 documentation.
* Assists with updating HR intranet pages (e.g., contacts and links on HR home page).
* Provides support to recruitment team, including parsing of resumes and solicitation of applicants.
* Assists with employment verifications.
* Prepares letters and memos as directed utilizing appropriate computer software (e.g., Microsoft Office).
* Assists with preparing expense reports and check requests for department.
* Works with management to ensure that all administrative tasks are being completed both timely and efficiently.
* Opens, reviews and distributes mail.
* Performs responsibilities of other support services when needed, including printing, scanning, duplicating, quality control, faxing and package deliveries.
* Assists as needed with special events for professional staff, including Employee Anniversary Recognition Program, annual State of the Firm, and Ethics Presentation.
* Demonstrates effective interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills to facilitate effective work relationships with others.
* Manages Firm resources responsibly.
* Complies with and understands Firm operation, policies and procedures.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.


Qualifications:* Knowledge of relevant firm computer software programs (e.g., Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint), with the ability to learn new software and operating systems
* Demonstrates effective interpersonal and communication skills, both verbally and in writing
* Demonstrates close attention to detail
* Ability to read, interpret and follow instructions
* Ability to handle multiple projects and shifting priorities
* Ability to handle sensitive matters and maintain confidentiality
* Ability to organize and prioritize work
* Ability to work well in a demanding and fast-paced environment
* Ability to work well independently as well as effectively within a team
* Ability to deal courteously/effectively with others
* Flexibility to adjust hours and work the hours necessary to meet operating and business needs


Education/Experience* High school diploma or equivalent
* Minimum of six months relevant experience in a professional services environment


Culture & Life at Skadden  

What makes Skadden special is our people and the culture, community and spirit of collaboration we have created. We believe in teamwork and inspiring each other to be our best in an atmosphere that promotes professionalism and excellence in all that we do. We know that inclusion, equity and drawing on the strength of a wide spectrum of diverse talent only make us better and is vital to the firm's success. Our goal is for everyone at the firm to enjoy a challenging career with opportunities for development and growth and to support the well-being of our attorneys and professional staff.
Benefits
The overall well-being of our team is important to us. We offer generous benefits to help you achieve wellness in all areas of your life.* Competitive salaries and year-end discretionary bonuses.
* Comprehensive health care (medical, dental, vision), savings plan/401(k) and voluntary benefits.
* Generous paid time off.
* Paid leave options, including parental.
* In-classroom, remote, and on-demand learning and professional development opportunities.
* Robust well-being classes and programs.
* Opportunities to give back and make an impact in local communities.


For further details, please visit: https://www.skadden.com/careers/staff/employee-benefits
The starting base salary for this position is expected to be within the range listed under Salary Details. Actual salary will be determined based on skills, experience (to the extent relevant) and other-job related factors, consistent with applicable law.
Salary Details
$27/hour to $32/hour

title: Quality Assurance Coordinator (OPWDD QA)
description:
**Community Options, Inc.** is a national non-profit agency providing services to individuals with disabilities in 12 states.

We are searching for an experienced **Quality Assurance Coordinator** in **Brookly**n**, NY** who will be responsible for monitoring the systematic operations of the residential and vocational programs. This person will serve as a liaison between the local office and the national office. This person will be held accountable for ensuring the appropriate implementation of policies and procedures and, ensuring programs are completely in compliance with state rules, regulations and agency policies.

***The hourly rate is is $24.038 a hour***

**Responsibilities:**

* Schedules and conducts QA audits of financial, personnel files to include training records, medication administration records, medical records, Therap and billing documentation
* Conduct comprehensive record reviews
* Conducts physical site inspections of homes and programs
* Submits a quarterly report card to the National Compliance and QA Director and to the Regional/State Director
* Conducts 30-day initial audit of all new homes and programs
* Coordination of the annual peer audits
* Audits individuals’ in-house accounts to verify that required documentation is maintained, accounts are monitored by the designated staff and balances are correct
* Communicates findings of audits to the Regional/State Director, Executive Director and National Compliance and QA Director
* Recommends any necessary changes in current policy and procedures
* Member of the National & Local QA committees
* Conducts staff training as needed
* Conducts investigations as needed
* Maintains a master file of all audits
* Must Cooperate with the licensee and department staff in any inspection, inquiry or investigation
* Additional tasks and responsibilities may be assigned

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field and three years of relevant experience
* Valid driver’s license with a satisfactory driving record
* Commitment to and knowledge of community-based support for persons with disabilities
* Working knowledge of management of an effective QA program, including training, monitoring, conducting and documenting investigations, addressing violations and monitoring corrective actions
* Ability to maintain effective relationships with employees, new hires, and the general public
* Excellent time management skills and the ability to develop and implement multiple priorities
* Ability to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form
* Independent judgment is required to plan, prioritize, and organize diversified workload
* Ability to demonstrate poise, tact, and diplomacy
* Excellent presentation and verbal skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office 365
* Knowledge and understanding of local regulatory agency operations

**Working Conditions:**

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple priorities
* While performing the duties of the job, employee travels by automobile, utilizing own vehicle, and is exposed to changing weather conditions
* Travels throughout a designated region
* Minimal hazards, general office working conditions
* Flexible schedule as determined by supervisor
* May be exposed to various medical conditions and communicable diseases

**Why Community Options?**

* Competitive Insurance Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* Paid Holidays—Including a Birthday Holiday
* Generous PTO
* Employee Incentive & Discount Programs
* 403b Retirement Plan
* Incredible career growth opportunities

*Community Options is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V*

#IND-BR

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $24.38 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Overtime

title: Afternoon- In Home - BCBA
description:
**GBS is looking for a BCBA in Rumson Monday through Friday 3:30pm-8pm.**

* Conduct initial and concurrent assessments and develop individualized treatment plans every six months.
* Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments and develop Behavior Intervention Plans during the initial assessment or at the onset of problem behavior.
* Review treatment plans and behavior intervention plans with the client’s parent/caregiver before initiating.
* Conduct data analysis, update goals and objectives, data sheets, and bring instructional materials to the clients session weekly.
* Check Graham Behavior Services email address weekly.
* Train behavior therapists on skill acquisition programs and behavior intervention plans.
* Provide instructional materials needed for therapy.
* Schedule monthly clinics with family, therapists, and director as needed.
* Provide parents and caregivers with training on Applied Behavior Analysis.

* Coordinate care between school, home, and other service providers.
* Monitors children for signs of child abuse, and reports incidents of suspected abuse to appropriate personnel immediately.
* When possible provide direct services to clients if behavior therapist are unable.
* Inform Director of any problems or concerns with staff, clients, client’s family, and systems or procedures used by Graham Behavior Services.
* Assist Director in conducting annual evaluations of behavior therapists.
* Maintain open communication with parents and behavior therapists including scheduling home programming.
* Alert Director if scheduling problems arise that cannot be resolved.
* Supervise BCBA, BCaBa, and RBT candidates at BCBA’s discretion.
* Attends meetings, events, trainings, workshops, and seminars as required by Graham Behavior Services.

* Consistently demonstrates a high level of integrity, responsibility, accountability, teamwork and ethics.
* Adheres to all policies, procedures and standard practices of Graham Behavior Services.

title: Development Assistant
description:
**Development Assistant**

UJA-JCC Greenwich is seeking a quality professional who will work closely with the Development team to ensure all campaign gifts and commitments are processed, recorded, and recognized correctly. The candidate will also provide back-end donor and team support to ensure data quality across all systems, primarily our CRM Raiser’s Edge. In addition, the candidate will assist with the agency's day-to-day activities. This individual interacts with the entire community and, most heavily, with leadership.

**Essential Functions:**

**Administrative and Communications**

* Manage front desk reception and all telephone inquiries; screen and monitor security system for building entry.
* Update and maintain the office calendar.
* Prepare thank you/tax letters for donors, event participants, and tribute cards.
* Manage logistics of campaign direct mail when not outsourced.
* Liaise with advertisers and assist with proofing and editing of agency publications.

**Systems and Database**

* Process all incoming records into the donor database, entering donations, pledges, and documentation, creating new accounts, and updating existing accounts.
* Ensure data integrity in Raisers Edge by finding and resolving duplicate entries, invalid addresses, improper salutations, and address changes.
* Ensure the database effectively captures constituent information.
* Design and run donor mailing, event registration, and other project-based reports for the Development team.
* Perform monthly checks of the UJA-JCC website for accuracy and to ensure marketing pro has updated information.

**Events and Board Management**

* Create name tags and assist in preparing Journals or programs.
* Procure food for meetings and assist with event set up, check-in, and breakdown as needed.
* Assist with scheduling board and committee meetings.
* Help coordinate allocations grant process and communications.
* Draft board minutes and maintain board and committee lists and files.

**Skills and Qualifications:**

· Bachelor's degree strongly preferred.

· Ability to work effectively and efficiently with donors, staff, vendors, and board members.

· Manage multiple projects simultaneously with high accuracy and attention to detail.

· High level of proficiency with PCs and Microsoft OS.

· Advanced skills in Word, Outlook, and Excel.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Able to respond quickly and effectively to a rapidly changing and demanding environment.

· Strong problem-solving skills.

· Learn new software and have an adventuresome orientation toward refreshing/enhancing one's computer software skills.

· Motivated, enthusiastic, proactive, and positive personality.

· Works cooperatively as a member of the team.

· Experience with databases, preferably experience with Blackbaud or other similar constituent relationship management or donor databases, is a plus.

· Experience with Constant Contact a plus.

· Able to lift and move objects up to 20 pounds.

**Compensation:**

UJA-JCC Greenwich offers a benefits package, including health insurance and paid time off. Competitive salary in the non-profit marketplace. Excellent professional development, mentoring, and skill-building opportunities.

The salary range for this position is $43,000 to $47,000, based on experience.

Independent and hands-on work in an exciting environment.

· Full-time

· $43,000.00 - $47,000.00 per year

* Health and dental insurance
* Paid time off
* Evenings as needed
* Weekends as needed

· In person

title: Academic Hospitalist
description:
The Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, in partnership with New York City Health + Hospitals/Queens, is delighted to invite applications for a full-time Academic Hospitalist position within our esteemed Department of Internal Medicine.

We're seeking a dedicated professional who will play an integral role in our team, providing top-tier patient care and contributing to the academic growth of our residents and medical students. This position is affiliated with the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, offering an enriching environment to both practice and teach medicine. The successful candidate will demonstrate strong inpatient clinical abilities, a background in teaching, and exemplary communication and interpersonal skills.

Our hospital, located in the heart of New York City, is easily accessible by both public transportation and car from all areas of NYC, New Jersey, and Long Island. To be considered for this position, candidates must be board certified/board eligible in Internal Medicine and possess a valid New York State License, DEA, and Medicaid number. In return, we offer a faculty appointment with the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, with rank commensurate with credentials, experience, and qualifications.

This is an excellent opportunity to join a vibrant academic community and contribute to the education of the next generation of physicians.

Join us in our mission to provide exceptional healthcare and shape the future of medicine. We look forward to considering your application.

*The Mount Sinai Health System (MSHS) provides equal employment opportunity to all its employees and applicants for employment without unlawful discrimination on the basis of their actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, gender identity, age, disability, marital or parental status, sexual orientation, veteran, immigration, citizenship, or other protected status.*

title: Assistant Teacher at Elementary School
description:
A highly successful public elementary school on the Upper West Side of Manhattan is seeking applicants to intern as assistant teachers (one assistant teacher per classroom in kindergarten to grade 5).

This paid internship will start September 4, 2024 and will end on June 26, 2025. Work hours are between 8:00 am to 2:50 pm every day that school is in session, requiring about 30 hours per week. These hours are not flexible and all work must be performed in-person.

The pay is $19 per hour. Health benefits are not provided with this position, but may be purchased out-of-pocket.

This internship provides invaluable classroom experience to individuals looking to start a career in education. Assistant teachers work under the direct guidance of a veteran teacher. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to providing one-on-one and small group support after a lesson has been delivered, conferencing with children to track progress over time, teaching small group lessons, supporting children socially and emotionally, and completing administrative tasks.

Although this internship is for the upcoming 2024-2025 academic year, it is possible to continue the internship through the following school year as well (2025-2026).

* Preference will be given to applicants currently enrolled in or having completed a graduate education program. Current graduate school students can complete fieldwork hours and/or student teaching hours simultaneously while working as an assistant teacher.
* Consideration will also be given to applicants with an undergraduate degree in education or who have had other related elementary education experience.
* **Candidates with no experience with school-aged children will not be considered.**
* **Candidates who have not graduated from college with a BA/BS will not be considered.**

Please note, this is not a Department of Education “teaching assistant” or paraprofessional job posting.

Pay: $19.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

description:
Chef prepares hot and cold foods according to the current menu for all programs using standardized recipes. Prepares and sets up service foods for dining room café. Ensures food safety, quality and freshness. Prepares foods for special functions as directed. Ensures kitchen safety and security. Supports Hospital's mission to provide the highest quality care by complying with regulatory guidelines, meeting agency standards, and obtaining appropriate certification.

**JOB DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES**

1. Demonstrates competency in all skills required for the preparation of menu items according to DOH and department standards in the proper quantity to meet the demands of all customers including texture modified meal plans/diets.

2. Reviews the menu to assess for changes and necessary times for preparation.

3. Prepares all menu items in a timely manner to ensure that the delivery of meals is in accordance to policy.

4. Prepares appetizing and nutritious meals according to department standards and production requirements.

5. Provides feedback to supervisor regarding menu acceptance by customers.

6. Observes infection control and food safety procedures. Maintains compliance to regulatory standards/guidelines.

7. Assists with department compliance to infection control procedures by providing verbal and/or written feedback to other department staff when non-compliance is observed.

8. Documents food temperatures daily.

9. Ensures that foods are served within acceptable temperatures; implements interventions  
as appropriate.

10. Completes job specific daily cleaning assignments.

11. Serves staff and visitor meals in a professional and courteous manner.

12. Performs other related duties and activities that may become necessary as directed.

Rotating weekly schedule:

Sunday 5:30am- 1:30pm

Monday 7:00am-3:00pm

Thursday 11:00am- 7:00pm

Friday 5:30am-1:30pm

Tuesday 5:30am-1:30pm

Wednesday 7:00am-3:00pm

Friday 11:00am-7:00pm

title: Clinical Supervisor
description:
**Comunilife** is looking for a compassionate, flexible, energetic, patient and organized individual with extensive knowledge of community mental health resources, counseling processes and practices. The Clinical Supervisor for our Bronx location oversees all clinical services and provides training, supervision and direction for a team of case managers, all of whom provide services for formerly homeless adults living with social services issues such as mental illness and/or HIV/AIDS. ***Comunilife offers a generous benefits and paid time off package to all full time employees. The salary range for this position is up to $65,000 a year.***

**Schedule:**

Tues.-Sat. 9am-5pm

**Essential Duties:**  
•The Clinical Supervisor will ensure effective delivery of support services from case managers for every client.

* Coordinate and supervise efforts with case management and maintenance staff to ensure a minimum monthly occupancy rate of 95% is maintained.
* Ensure that the initial and medical assessments are conducted, and that comprehensive service plans are developed that identify mutually agreed upon long and short-term goals.
* Review and provide supervision in the development of case management service plans and ensure that reassessments are conducted on a quarterly basis (at minimum) to ensure that services are appropriate for the clients current needs.
* Provide oversight and supervision in the delivery of mental health and alcohol/substance abuse services and referrals, including assistance in accessing primary medical care, assistance with adherence to medication regimens, activities for daily living, nutritional services and delivery of any other services necessary for clients to increase their capacity for independent living.

**Qualifications:**

* Licensed Master’s of Social Work (LMSW) or New York State Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW)
* Two (2) to five (5) years’ supervisory work experience, overseeing a case management team.
* Credentialed Alcohol and Substance Abuse Counseling (CASAC-T or CASAC) is a plus
* Experience with HIV/AIDS afflicted individuals, chronic mental illness, substance abuse individuals and their families
* Bilingual skills in English/Spanish a plus

title: Fulfillment Associate
description:
**About us**

HIGH FREQUENCTEA is a small, family-owned business in Teaneck, NJ.

Are you passionate about precision and ensuring customers receive their orders with care and efficiency? We're seeking a dedicated Fulfillment Associate to join our team. In this role, you'll play a vital part in preparing and dispatching our products, contributing to a seamless and delightful customer experience.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Crafting Shipments with Precision:** Your day starts with printing orders and meticulously preparing post office labels. You'll then expertly package orders, ensuring each item is carefully placed for safe transit.
* **Tailoring Presentation:** You'll be responsible for beautifully bagging teas, powders and more, ensuring they're snugly housed in their designated packaging for a professional and appealing finish.
* **Herbal Pill Expertise:** You'll be the maestro behind bottling, labeling, and expertly sealing our herbal capsules. Your attention to detail ensures that every product meets our high standards.
* **Solving Customer Order Queries:** You'll assist in managing order-related email issues and and ensuring our customers' concerns are resolved with satisfaction.
* **Master of Supplies:** Maintaining a well-stocked inventory is essential. You'll keep a vigilant eye on our supplies, reporting when herbs or other materials run low so that our operations remain seamless.
* **Workspace Stewardship:** A clean and organized workspace is vital for efficiency and safety. You'll take pride in maintaining a spotless environment, ensuring everything is in its place.

**Qualifications:**

* Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail, leaving no room for error when it comes to order preparation and packaging.
* Organized: You excel at keeping things in order, from managing inventory to maintaining a clean workspace.
* Customer-Centric: You understand that our customers are at the heart of everything we do, and you're committed to ensuring their satisfaction.
* Adaptable: You thrive in a dynamic environment and are open to occasional adjustments in job duties to meet evolving needs.

**Join Our Team:**

Embark on a fulfilling journey with us, where your meticulous approach and dedication to customer satisfaction make a tangible impact. If you're ready to be an integral part of our mission to provide top-notch products and service, apply today!

*Note: Job duties are subject to reasonable change as operational needs evolve.*

title: Care Coordinator - Scatter Site
description:
**Comunilife Inc.** is looking for experienced **Care Coordinators** to join it Care Coordination Team. The Care Coordinator is responsible for providing care management for clients and their families/support system and advocates for clients to obtain the full range of needed services and ensures coordination of these services. The Care Coordinator promotes linkage development and monitors the effectiveness of linkages with other services providers. The Care Coordinator ensures community follow-up to engage the client in care, promotes compliance with medical appointments, and encourages client self-sufficiency and empowerment. ***This position is eligible for Comunilife's benefit package including health insurance, dental, vision, dependent care, paid time off, 401(k), tuition assistance program and more.*** 

**This position will require working in The Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens**

**Essential Duties:**

* Reports to assigned Care Coordination Program Director and meets on a weekly basis for supervision or more often if needed.
* Utilizes approved Home Health assessment tool and Health Information Technology (HIT) to prepare initial and ongoing clinical and psychosocial assessments of service needs to identified members. Identifies level of need and tailors care plan accordingly, reassessing as needed.
* Monitors member progress and produces/maintains detailed, accurate and timely documentation of case notes.
* Responds to inpatient and ER admission alerts and contacts medical provider/hospitals for admission/discharge information.
* Recognizes member as a contributing member of care team through motivational interviewing techniques, continuous transference and reinforcement of self-management skills.
* Provides support to member and family, including but not limiting to locating resources to eliminate barriers and advocating on behalf of member and their supports to ensure they have supports necessary to improve their health.
* Documents a monthly HML assessment for each assigned member.
* Develops resources for referral in all areas needed to assist clients.
* Ensures care management team will provide care coordination, appropriate linkages, referrals and follow-up for needed services and supports.
* Advocates for necessary services on behalf of the clients.
* Conducts home visits and agency visits as needed and as is outlined in the Care Plan.
* Completes Health Risk Assessments, Care Plans, service notes, referrals, linkages, advocacy and follow-up for clients and completes appropriate paperwork associated with such services daily including documentation in all Electronic Medical Records for the corresponding Health Homes.
* Works closely with Care Coordination Program Director to assure quality program service delivery and participates in Utilization Review/Quality Improvement process.
* Participate in case finding, networking and outreach activities to increase clients’ enrollment.
* Works closely with agency’s program directors to ensure assure continuity of care within the organization.

**Education and Experience Requirement(s)**

* Associate’s Degree in human services or related field
* Two (2) years’ administrative work experience
* Experience with HIV/AIDS afflicted individuals, chronic mental illness, substance abuse individuals and their families a plus
* Bilingual skills in English/Spanish a plus
* Knowledge and hands-on experience in providing direct services related to the treatment and recovery of persons with HIV/AIDS, substance abuse, serious mental illness, and homelessness
* Excellent oral and written communication skills; proficiency with MS Office and Google product suites
* Ability to perform and manage in a team approach; excellent interpersonal skills
* Ability to handle complex challenges and balance multiple demands on time and attention
* Ability and willingness to perform all duties as workload necessitates

Comunilife is an EEO employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Content Specialist
description:
**Position Description**

Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory, located on the North Shore of Long Island, New York, has an immediate opening for a scientifically qualified Content Specialist for its rapidly growing preprint servers bioRxiv and medRxiv. The person in this new position will join the team that screens submitted papers. The successful candidate will engage with authors, the affiliate scientists who assess manuscripts’ suitability for posting, readers who comment on posted manuscripts, and community members with questions about preprint server procedures and policies. Applicants must be able to handle overlapping projects and deadlines simultaneously. Attention to detail and ease of communication with stakeholders that include scientists, technologists, and business colleagues are essential.

**Position Responsibilities**

* Assisting with the daily screening of bioRxiv and medRxiv submissions
* Communicating with authors who have submitted manuscripts about decisions, appeals, withdrawals, and other issues
* Answer general queries submitted to the server helpdesks concerning submissions, procedures and policies
* Responding to correspondence concerning preprints already posted on the preprint servers
* Liaising with the Production and Technology Teams to investigate author and reader queries
* Moderating submitted comments for on-site posting
* Contributing to the development of screening policies and procedures with the Content Team
* Assisting in team projects to expand the scope, reach, and functionality of bioRxiv and medRxiv

**Position Requirements**

*Skills & Experience:* In-depth understanding of all aspects of the communication of biomedical research results. Experience with writing and critiquing scientific manuscripts. Excellence in written and verbal interactions with authors and others. Strong interpersonal team-oriented skills. Excellent organizational and prioritization skills. Prior experience in manuscript assessment and/or selection for biomedical research journals  
*Education:* PhD in a biomedical discipline

**Supplemental Information**

**How to Apply:**  
Come join our team, and we'll match your excitement for scientific innovation with opportunities to shape the future of research dissemination! Please submit an online application here: Content Specialist Position 1238 . We look forward to reviewing your application.

**Environment**  
Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory is a world-renowned biomedical research institution in New York. It has shaped contemporary biomedical research and is the home of eight Nobel Prize laureates. Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory provides a highly dynamic and interactive research environment and also a unique opportunity of timely exposure to advances in various biomedical research fields and of interaction with a broad range of researchers from all over the world through its renowned Meetings and Courses program. We believe that science is for everyone. We have had researchers with a variety of backgrounds and believe in the importance of diversity, equity, and inclusion.

**Compensation and Benefits**

title: One-to-One Direct Support Professional - A Career With Meaning
description:
**The Nicholas Center - Revolutionizing The Way Autistic Adults Learn, Live & Work!** 

**The Nicholas Center** is an innovative organization offering meaningful opportunities within an exciting, supportive workplace environment.

Work at the #1 Nonprofit on Long Island, which has recently added a 2nd location in Westchester in 2020.

**Job Summary:** We are seeking a compassionate and dedicated individual to join the Nicholas Center Westchester as a **One-to-One Direct Support Professional** for an adult with autism.

As a **One-to-One Direct Support Professional**

support professional, you will be responsible for providing personalized assistance to an individual with autism in their daily life. Your role will involve implementing and monitoring individualized plans, promoting independence, and helping the individual achieve their goals.

**For more about what makes The Nicholas Center a great place to work, visit our website at:** https://tncnewyork.org/join-our-team

**Positions Available:** **One-to-One Direct Support Professional (DSP)**

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday 9AM to 4PM \\*Ideal, flexible schedule for a parent/caregiver or someone who needs/wants to work another job!

**Benefits for One-to-One Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

* Medical insurance
* Paid Time Off and federal holidays
* Paid family leave
* Short/long term disability
* Employee assistance program
* Online training and professional development
* Bonuses for exemplary annual performance

**Job Duties & Responsibilties for One-to-One Direct Support Professional (DSP):**

* Provide one-to-one support to an adult with autism in the community, and workplace.
* Implement individualized plans designed to meet the specific needs of the individual, as directed by the supervising clinician.
* Help the individual develop social and communication skills, as well as daily living skills such as self-care, and social, emotional, and vocational skills.
* Assist the individual in participating in recreational activities that align with their interests and preferences.
* Monitor and document the individual's progress and report any changes or concerns to the supervising clinician.
* Maintain a safe and clean environment for the individual, ensuring their physical and emotional well-being.
* Work collaboratively with other members of the support team.
* Attend training and development sessions to improve knowledge and skills related to autism and direct support.
* Be prompt, organized and respectful to your co-workers, the people you support and the members of the community.
* Adhere to the Organizational Core Values - People, Professionalism, Community, Innovation, Integrity (training provided).
* Adhere to the organization’s Code of Ethics and perform your duties satisfactory as outlined in the Core Competencies (training provided).
* Complete all required training and maintain confidentiality.

**Minimum Job Qualifications for One-to-One Specialist (DSP):**

* 18 years of age or older
* High School completion is required.
* Must be able to bend and lift items 30 lbs or less.
* Must be able to multi-task and stand for the majority of the day.
* Clean and valid driver’s license and no infractions that preclude a person from working with members of a vulnerable population.

**Experience Needed:** Experience preferred.

**License:** Driver's License (Preferred)

title: Full-time Associate Account Executive
description:
**Associate Account Executive**

Stateside Affairs is seeking an Associate Account Executive. This role involves managing clients’ needs supporting strategic marketing and communications efforts, and contributing to the development and execution of public relations and government affairs campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in public relations, media relations, and government affairs, with excellent organizational and communication skills. This is a full-time position and some travel is required. Potential work sites include Manasquan and Elizabeth, with remote work as permitted.

Tasks may be adjusted according to company needs and compliance with applicable employment laws.

**Objectives:**

* Under the guidance of senior leadership, this individual will act as the account manager for several clients, serving as an extension of Stateside Affairs.
* Enhance client relationships, ensuring that client needs are met and expectations are exceeded

**Responsibilities:**

* Write, edit, and distribute press releases, media advisories, and pitches, among various other types of written content across social media posts, newsletters, and video scripts.
* Help build and maintain relationships with media contacts and facilitate media coverage for Stateside Affairs and its clients.
* Assist in the planning and execution of campaigns, including event coordination, social media management, and distributing newsletters.
* Oversee multilingual marketing, public relations, and community outreach campaigns including ad messenger campaigns and media buy plans across tv, radio, digital, and print.
* Oversee the development of client websites and execute bi-weekly/monthly updates.
* Assist in the creation and execution of a strategic plan for social media channels, including writing content and creating graphics/videos and tracking posts in a content calendar.
* Design flyers, evites, and other marketing collateral.
* Provide administrative support including scheduling meetings, organizing materials.

**Requirements:**

* At least three years of experience in public and/or government relations or a related field
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Outstanding interpersonal skills and an ability to work effectively as part of a team
* Ability to work well under pressure and manage sensitive subjects with professionalism
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
* Familiarity with social media platforms (LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook etc.)
* Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.
* Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, and able to prioritize, multi-task, and meet deadlines

**Preferred skills and qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in public relations, communications, marketing, English, Spanish, or related field
* Completion of courses in public affairs, public speaking, or creative or technical writing
* Bilingual abilities are an asset
* Knowledge of photo and video-editing software is an asset
* Experience in project management, event coordination, customer/community relations

For inquiries or to submit resume:

Manasquan, NJ 08736-2946
